This group is for anyone who likes watching movies free before they are released and meet new friends at the same time. They are called screenings and are free.

These movies are usually screened Mon. to Thur. 7 PM.  Members are required to get in line starting at 5 PM but should be in line before 6.  These times depend on the movies appeal.  Seats are not guaranteed since they overbook to assure a full house.

This may not work for all people with jobs and or may have to travel to the theater screening the movie.

Friendships will develop over time while waiting in line and than after being seated waiting for the movie to start. After the movie may want to do something with a new friend or friends and than you get to be the first to blog about it on your Facebook page or Tweet it to your followers or any social group your into.

Please use your full name when signing up or at least a last initial with your first name if your afraid of stalkers.  It helps when I need to search for members.  Also your join date helps for me to find you.

To cover costs to run this group we had to require a $5. yearly fee.  New members have 30 days to decide if they like the group and want to remain a member.

results.description: We are Bay State Learning Cooperative, and we are opening a self-directed learning center in the Boston area in 2014. We are based on the North Star Learning Center model, which has been in operation since 1996 and has a long track record of success. We believe that traditional school models are not always a good fit for many students whose innate gifts and interests are not being cultivated in a public school setting. We know from our experience in the public school system that students must have a controlling interest in their own education if they are to have any kind of deep and genuine learning experience. If you would like to know more about the specifics of what we propose, please visit our website: www.baystatelearning.org We are looking for parents to help us grow this unique education community.

topics.name: Support for People with Hearing Loss

results.description:
Did you know that more than 48 MILLION people have hearing loss?!

Being deaf often means being part of a unique community that hearing people are not part of. Hearing people routinely go and socialize at events where they think little of having to listen and hear. This is a group for those of us in between; those of us who are hard of hearing, late deafened, orally deaf, use hearing aids and/or cochlear implants. We live and work in a hearing world and know very little or no sign. We are able to hear to do our jobs but are limited socially when our friends want to go to the movies or a concert, etc. Captioning helps but isn't always available or easily accessible. Let's get together and just talk. It'll be nice to know that there are others out there who are "straddling the divide."

Please check out our sponsor, Hearing Loss Association of America Boston Chapter, website: HLAA Boston Chapter, or click on the link to the left of this page under Our Sponsors.
results.name: Straddling the Divide - Living with Hearing Loss

It offers a place to be around folks with a common love of dancing. It offers music that will soothe your soul, make your toes tap, and fingers snap.  It offers the opportunity to meet new folks with similar interest. It offers networking opportunities.  When you join the culture you will be so excited and wonder where has this been, I have been waiting for this for a long time!  Come join us!

results.description:
Daytraders are amazing people.  It takes a certain kind of passion and intellect to bring entrepreneurial skills into the realm of financial engineering to manifest self directed investment.  Enabled by the power of the computer, the connectivity of the Internet and the deregulation of the SEC, self made traders find themselves at the bleeding edge of a new revolution of wealth creation. 

Daytrading is not for the faint of heart but the alternative of working for someone else can make you feel like you're part of a 20 mule team.  Finding security in long term employment is a thing of the past and pension plans aren't what they used to be.  However, financial engineering can be accessed through day trading and it's a lot more fun when you share your experiences with others.

After graduating with a master's degree in Engineering and taking my first job as a consultant, I wanted to invest my money to generate enough wealth to become financially independent.  Years later I found I was no closer to my goal and the world of work left me cold.  I set about exploring different forms of entrepreneurship but when I discovered daytrading, the passion that fueled my work ethic reemerged like a phoenix from the ashes.  I started this group as a place where traders can celebrate their successes as well as find support and advice to do their not-always-so-easy job.  Come join us!
results.name: Daytrade!

topics.name: Making a Difference in the World

results.description: Welcome to "Biology and the Computer after Dark"! Whether you are an academic researcher, a coder, an entrepreneur, an industry professional, or simply a dreamer and a doer, we want to meet YOU. Borne from a collaboration between the Helix Bioscience Institute-HBI (www.helixbioscience.org) and Science Shaping Our World-SHOW (www.scienceshapingourworld.com), Biology and the "Computer after Dark" seeks to provide a venue for a diverse and innovative gathering of individuals interested in the amazing potential that exists within multidisciplinary groups with the desire to bring about positive change. In a business casual setting, old friends and new, can gather to network, share their ideas, pose challenges, raise a toast, tell a joke, and share in the group camaraderie. Despite our many “touch points” that allow us to be virtually connected 24/7, we often find ourselves more disconnected from each other than ever before. In the hyperfast pace of our daily lives, we are awash in an ever-increasing fog of noise and distraction that can obscure those things most important to us. Through this meetup we seek to do exactly that “meetup", connect, share, and create a rich "physical network" of colleagues and friends that can serve to enrich our professional as well as personal lives. With that I invite you to joins us for an evening of intellectual stimulation, good food, great company, and beer!
results.name: Biology and the Computer after Dark

results.description:
"Calling all Real Estate Investors, Real Estate Professionals, Realtors, Mortgage Banker's, Attorney's, Investment Bankers, Traders, Contractor's and anyone active in the Real Estate Industry. Are your hitting your goals you set for yourself this year? If not, your clearly doing something wrong as right now everyone knows we are in the best time to buy, and sell real estate!

Greater Boston Real Estate & Investors Associations (REIA) was Established in 2013. Today Massachusetts Real Estate & Investors Associations is the largest & fastest growing real estate investment community in the tri-state area!

Whether you are just starting out in real estate investing and looking to learn, or are working on deal number one-hundred, the Greater Boston Real Estate & Investors Associations can help you accomplish your goals all while having a ton of fun doing it. You are here because you know this is the best times to invest in real estate and you're right!

Greater Boston Real Estate & Investors Associations members include beginner, seasoned, full, and part-time investors, accountants and attorneys, real estate agents and brokers, contractors, mortgage lenders, property appraisers and inspectors, property managers, and renovation specialists — people looking to enjoy the many benefits of the real estate industry.

We invite you to learn more about Greater Boston Real Estate & Investors Associations, by joining us at our next General Meeting. Guests are always welcome and RSVPing is highly encouraged. Guest fees may be applied toward membership.

results.description:
The Boston Real Estate Investor Association, is an Investor Association for real estate investors and other real estate professionals dedicated to the highest level of professionalism and integrity. 

Whether you have been involved in the real estate industry for years or are just getting started, you will feel at home at our group since we will be catering to all levels of knowledge and experience. 

We will be providing you:

•  Access to local, national and international experts, trainers and experienced investors who are actively investing

• Access to local vendors and service providers that matter Fun, exciting network opportunities with other like minded professionals and industry experts,

• Ongoing educational opportunities for new and seasoned investors on many different real estate strategies 

• A platform to market your properties to other investors and buyers as well as allowing you to be the first to purchase other member properties 

• A Main Meeting on the first Tuesday of each month 

• Specialty satellite meetup groups that meet throughout the month at locations around town 

• Other seminars, workshops, bus tours, webinars, and meetups throughout the year to keep you informed on the exciting and ever changing real estate market 

We are a different from other Boston area real estate investor meetings in that we do not focus on bringing in national speakers each and every month who want to sell you books, cds and seminars for thousands of dollars. Instead, we will be focusing on delivering you affordable, local real estate education taught by local investors and professionals who are actually doing deals.  

We are also putting a very strong emphasis on live networking events, social networking and community outreach programs through local charities whom we help build, renovate and repair homes for needy families in the Boston area. We multiple meetings each month that you need to know about and attend…
results.name: Boston Real Estate Investors Association

topics.name: Mah Jongg for Experienced & Novice Players

results.description:
This meetup is for any new or experienced person who is interested in playing American style Mah Jongg in the Peabody MA vicinity.

What do you need to play?

• A rule card for the current year (this shows the permissible hands). Some extras will be made available as loaners, but you can purchase them for $7-$8 online at Amazon.com or the National Mah Jongg League web site.

• A Mah Jongg set (tiles, racks and dice). The group organizer will bring 1-2 sets to each meetup. As our group grows, it would be great if members with their own sets can bring one as well. If you want to buy your own set, they run roughly $100 for the tiles, racks and carrying case. A great source for sets is wherethewindsblow.com.

• Enthusiasm and patience. It takes a while to learn how to play Mah Jongg, but it's definitely worthwhile. It never gets boring and will give you years of enjoyment! Some members are new to Mah Jongg, and we'll help them learn the rules and get practice to hone their skills.


Choose Files from the More menu to see a Word or PDF document that explains the basic rules for American Mah Jongg.
results.name: Peabody Mah Jongg Meetup

results.description:
Inquisitive, respectful, compassionate armchair philosophers explore whether ethics can be objective, whether human freedom can be rigorously justified, whether initiation of violence is ever ethically permissible, and whether any state can morally support human freedom. We also explore how to address -- compassionately, but from universal, consistent ethical principles: 

• common objections to human freedom (e.g., "But how will roads be built?" "How will the poor survive?" "How will we defend ourselves from Iran?" "How can I stop my child from messing up his life with drugs.")? 

• false morality claims that justify the initiation of violence (e.g., "It is Good to pay teachers more.", "It is moral to protect ourselves before we are attacked.", "It is Good to pay everyone a living wage." "It is moral to prevent women from selling themselves.")

And we study important thinkers in this area.

If moral relativism, nihilism, utilitarianism, religious morals, ethics dictated by Authority, democratic ethics, etc. have felt wrong to you, but you couldn't clearly state why, come and help us figure it out.

Please join our discussion.

• Read the notes from our first meeting

results.description:
Our mission is to gather those who had successfully lost weight and those who has experiences in weight lose and willing to help others to help those who wants to control their weights. We will teach them how to eat healthy, maintain a healthy lifestyle, and losing weight naturally without gaining back.
This Meet Up will open to everyone. We are really welcome those who wants to help others to lose weight or those who wants to control their weights. This is a free, non-profit organization.
我来自于中国大陆，来美前曾在吉林大学中日联谊医院从事临床及教学工作15年，任副教授，副主任医师，研究生导师。2001年受国家教委公派去日本东京大学留学，并取得博士学位。2007年来美国从事博士后研究。现工作于波士顿的某家大型医疗机构。
我出生于中医世家，从小接受的教育就是“不为良相，必为良医”。来美国后亲眼目睹很多美国人被肥胖所带来的疾病所折磨！也有很多人过早的离世！我利用美国的先进技术，用自然的方法，成功的帮助到很多人减肥成功！
我们的宗旨是：聚集一些减肥成功，有减肥经验的并愿意帮助他人，有爱心的有志之士。共同帮助一些想控制体重的人。主要教会他们如何健康饮食，如何保持良好的生活习惯。如何用自然的方法成功减肥，并不反弹！
本Meet Up 的对象是所有的人！既欢迎愿意帮助他人减肥的人，也欢迎自己想控制体重的人。本Meet Up 不收取任何费用。属于非盈利活动。

results.description: This is a group I started because I am a lolita who doesn't know anyone who has similar interests (Lolita fashion) It is for anyone interested in Lolita fashion and anything cute and adorable! The majority of our groups will be held at my house in North Reading. We will talk, drink tea, make cookies and other sweets, watch anime, and discuss field trips we would like to take together. Some examples are: going out to lunch, any upcoming anime conventions, going to the movies, ice skating, going out on a walk. But anything is possible! Can't wait to see you!
results.name: North Reading Lolita Fashion and cute things social group!

results.description:
The Network of South Asian Professionals of Boston (NetSAP Boston) (www.netsapboston.org) is a chapter of the NetIP America. Our mission is to serve as the unequivocal voice for the South Asian diaspora in Boston by developing and engaging a cohesive network of professionals to benefit the community. The backbone of the NetSAP community consists of not only professionals, but also leaders in business, politics, and civic life. We interact closely with the industry leaders and other South Asian organizations in furtherance of our goals. We will continue to interact closely with many of the acquaintances we make through our experiences within the NetSAP Boston organization. 

NetSAP Boston believes that our members are undeniably our greatest resource. We strive ardently to work with everyone in our local communities to provide a single platform for progressive professionals to target the many opportunities and challenges that come our way. The NetSAP Boston board members are comprised of very talented and passionate professionals pulled from various educational and professional background from engineers, doctors, advisory consultants to law students.
results.name: NetSAP Boston

results.description:
Sometimes, you just want to try a dish that scares your feebler friends away. I'm starting this group to build a network of adventurous eaters in Boston! It's never fun to sit down to dinner alone, especially when there are crickets involved. We'll work with local restaurants and chefs to host small dinners in the city and surrounding suburbs to meet new people over exotic, authentic and truly exciting food you might not otherwise have a chance to enjoy!

NOTE: Space will be limited, so dinners will likely be with 10-12 people. Watch out for dinner announcements to grab a chair at the table!
results.name: Boston Gastronauts

results.description: Does everything about food excite you? We're not talking about just the eating part, but also learning where it comes from (e.g., farms, kitchen gardens etc.), where it is sold (e.g., outdoor markets, ethnic neighborhoods, restaurants etc.), how it is prepared (e.g., smoked, blanched, steamed, fried etc.), and much, much more... Our goal in this group is to explore all things food-related - from eating at unique restaurants, attending food-themed workshops and embarking on food crawls of ethnic neighborhoods to attending cooking demos, taking classes and teaching each other our favorite dishes while cooking together. We look forward to sharing many culinary adventures!
results.name: Well Fed - Boston-area Ultimate Foodies & Cooks

topics.name: MBTI INFJ INFP INTJ INTP ISFJ ISFP ISTJ ISTP HSP

results.description:
If the name of this group appealed to you then I doubt you need paragraph after paragraph describing what an introvert is. You know what the general perception of you is and that it tends to be far from the truth. Exhibit A: the first Google search result for "definition of introvert": noun: 1. a shy, reticent, and typically self-centered person. Really, Google?! You were doing OK until you described us as "self-centered"...

If you're on this site it's because you're looking to meet new people, and for introverts that can be a scary endeavor. I'll admit up front that I joined this site more than two years ago and I haven't attended an event yet. If this sounds like you let's change that together. My hope is that by clearly defining our age range and the types of activities we will be partaking in we will attract like-minded individuals who have common interests and passions, which will lead to meaningful connections. I also plan on mixing things up in an effort to not let the group get monotonous. Boston is a fun city which merits exploration in lieu of hanging out at the same coffee shop, bar, or bowling alley. A sampling of potential events:

• Restaurant meetups, with an emphasis on culinary offerings (I am a foodie) in a comfortable setting. Perhaps do them in a variety of series? (international, adventurous, seasonal, restaurant week, brunch, tapas, dessert)

• Bar/coffee shop meetups in small groups (4-6 people) in a laid back environment that is conducive to conversation

• Wine tastings, brewery/distillery tours

• Movie meetups - more cerebral movies instead of blockbusters (indie/foreign/art house), with the occasional must-see 3D movie (Boston Common, Coolidge Corner, Kendall Square, Harvard Film Archive, Brattle Theatre, Somerville Theater)

• Concerts - more intimate venues/jazz clubs (MFA, The Sinclair, Paradise Rock Club, Brighton Music Hall, The Middle East, Cafe 939, Orpheum Theatre, Club Passim, Regattabar, Symphony Hall, Berklee Performance Center) instead of large, loud, crowded venues

• Lectures (Harvard, MFA)

• Comedy shows (Wilbur Theatre, Laugh Boston)

• Sporty activities (snow tubing, ice skating, bowling, hiking)

• Sporting events (Red Sox, Celtics)

• Museum/aquarium outings

• you get the idea...

Please Note: this group is meant for those between the ages of 20-39. Membership will be limited to those that fall within this age range. For those who fall outside that range I appreciate your interest but hope you will join and participate in other groups that are targeted at your demographics and interests. If you feel none exist I would suggest you create one.

Code of Conduct: I ask that you please be respectful to me, our other members, and the businesses/vendors we interact with (e.g. servers, business owners, etc.). Rudeness or behavior that makes other members uncomfortable will not be tolerated and you will be removed from the group. If you encounter such behavior please let me know as my goal is to preserve a comfortable and friendly environment.

New Members: if you submit an incomplete profile or have a profile picture that isn't of you (nature, animal, etc) then your membership request will be declined
results.name: 20s & 30s Boston Introverted Explorers

results.description: Stuck in a rut with the same circle of friends and co-workers for quite a few years now? I just turned 30 and am in the same boat. I want to meet some awesome new people and maybe do some things for a good cause at the same time. I am new to the Lowell area and didn't seem to find many meetup groups near here. I love the idea of this website but didn't want to drive an hour to Boston to meet a bunch of people I don't know! Who is with me? Any ideas for awesome places in or around the Lowell area would be much appreciated!
results.name: Lowell Areas Places and People

results.description:
Social Group for the LGBT community living in and around Dorchester MA. Why travel Downtown, when you can meet others right in your neighborhood. While we will try to have events in a variety of places, most events will take place right here in Dorchester. If the group grows large enough, I will be looking for co-organizers to assist me. I love the arts and socializing in a relax atmosphere so a lot of my event ideas will be focused around that. However, I look forward to working with other leaders in the lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender community interested in co-organizing and giving the group new dimension.

Need a ride?: Feel free to message me, call me or text me. Lloyd Mandrell 617-818-0403.  Just introduce yourself and let me know what group your from.  If I can't pick you up myself, I will try to find you someone I'm familiar with, within the group, whom can.
results.name: The Dorchester LGBT Group

results.description:
We're here to talk about, program, share, and demonstrate software, hardware, and ideas for the upcoming new wave of virtual reality.  Whether you're an avatar who spends more time in virtual worlds than the real one or someone who's never even worn a head mounted display, you'll find a great group of people who love VR. Each month we bring in presenters from companies who are pioneering VR technology and also feature an array of demonstrations created by our local VR developers. They can help you embark comfortably on your first VR experience or dive deep into VR design and discuss the latest news from the fast changing world of VR.

Join us on Google Groups BostonVR

On Twitter @BostonVRMeetup

Also at our LinkedIn group 

And on YouTube thanks to Robo Mouse Reporter
results.name: Boston Virtual Reality

results.description:
NSCoder Night is a monthly get-together for iOS/Mac developers. If you've got a project you want to hack on, or a problem you'd like help with bring it along. If not, just bring yourself. Developers of all experience levels more than welcome.

Who should join: Objective-C developers of all experience levels are welcome! Even if you've never even opened Xcode, we'd love to help get you up to speed!

Why you should join: No matter what your experience level, you'll be hard-pressed to find a better way to be able to ask other devs the questions that are keeping you up at night. It's also a great opportunity to solidify your knowledge by teaching. Additionally, there will be plenty of great conversation with a group of intelligent like-minded people.

What can you expect? This meetup is super laid back. After a brief introduction, we'll naturally fall into smaller working groups. People might be working individually, or in small groups, but there will always be interesting conversations about areas of iOS/Mac development that you might not be aware of.
results.name: NSCoder Night Boston

results.description: This is a group to provide single parents with fun activities to help them rebuild their social lives following separation, divorce or the death of a spouse. This group also provides events and resources to give single parents support, education and guidance in all areas to help change the course of their and their children's lives. While the purpose of this group is centered around single parents, all are welcome to join! This group is for single parents as well as anyone looking to make a difference in the lives of single parents, including professionals and business owners who provide services relating to tax and legal issues, as well as health, wellness and family issues.
results.name: HOPE for Single Parents - Boston and Metrowest

results.description:
Successful startup ecosystems begin with a collaborative culture.

Boston Startup Founder 101 brings together aspiring and experienced tech entrepreneurs to discuss, meet, and collaborate to build great new startups in Boston, and to push the local startup ecosystem forward.

In this group you can learn the best practices of starting a company from people who have been there and done that. In addition, you can meet local founders, exchange ideas, get feedback, engage in startup workshops, meet business partners, and more.

Join the group to be invited to our next event!
results.name: Boston Startup Founder 101

results.description:
Isha Yoga offers free meditation classes, classical hatha yoga programs, public events, and social gatherings for adults and families to learn yoga and meditation, practice yoga and meditate together and have fun!   In accordance with Meetup guidelines, any children under the age of 18 present at an Isha Yoga Meetup must be supervised by a parent or guardian.  

We look forward to meeting you, soon!

-----------------

What is Isha Yoga? 

Isha Yoga was founded by Isha Foundation, an international nonprofit organization dedicated to raising human consciousness. The Foundation offers powerful tools for inner wellbeing from the ancient science of yoga.  Through classical yoga and meditation, Isha empowers individuals to transform their lives, raising the consciousness of humanity one person at a time. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hUeyqLTsGJs

Jump right in!   Meditate Effortlessly on your own right NOW!... 

Try Isha Kriya, FREE Guided Meditation at www.IshaKriya.com 

Isha Kriya Free Guided Meditation:

Many people find meditation difficult and frustrating when they first begin practicing, struggling with the ceaseless activity of the mind and restlessness of the body. Often, people give-up on meditation before they can reap its incredible benefits, including stress reduction, relaxation, inner peace and mental focus. 

The Isha Kriya guided meditation is a simple, but powerful inner process to align your mind, body, and inner-energies to naturally arrive at a meditative state.  Once you are meditative for even a few minutes on a daily basis, your perception of yourself and the world around becomes much deeper and richer. 

Isha Kriya guided meditation can be learned through 1-hour free meditation classes (live, local to you on Meetup), live online meditation webinars (listed weekly on Meetup, FB, Twitter), anytime through our online guided meditation video (at IshaKriya.com), or anytime and anywhere with the Isha Kriya Mobile App, available for free on all Android and Apple mobile devices.  Search for Isha Kriya in your play store to download. Meditate anywhere... then share the bliss with a friend!

12-18 minutes of Isha Kriya meditation practice daily reduces stress, anxiety and depression; increases health, energy and vitality; enhances mental focus and clarity and establishes a sense of peace and deep inner balance. Isha Kriya meditation is a gentle, seated practice. No previous yoga or meditation experience is necessary.  Realized yogi, Sadhguru, explains more about the Isha Kriya free guided meditation in the introductory video below...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K4hCvdDn7Zc

"Meditation is a simple process that gives you a little distance from your own mind and your own body," explains realized yogi, Sadhguru. "You have probably heard of the word 'Buddha.' 'Bu' means 'buddhi,' or the intellect. 'Dha' means 'dada,' or one who is above. One who is 'above his intellect' is a Buddha. A Buddha has clear perception of the nature of his mind...Once you are in your intellect, stress, anxiety and tension are very normal; Once there is a distance from your physical body and your mental structure, that is the end of suffering." 

----------------------- 

Take a Deeper Step and Completely Transform Your Life:  
Eliminate Stress, Improve Relationships, Enhance Mental Clarity and Much, MUCH, more...

Inner Engineering Online Program - 7 Life-transforming Sessions in Your own Space:

"If life were to come with a manual, this in my opinion would be it! If we all applied the Inner Engineering technology, our world would instantly transform to exist from a foundation of peace, joy, and compassion for all beings." ~Evita Ochel, Evolving Beings, Consciousness Expansion and Heart-centered Living. 

What is Inner Engineering about? Inner Engineering is a 7-session online course that provides tools and solutions to empower yourself to create your life the way you want it. The program has been designed by Sadhguru, a yogi, visionary, and one the foremost authorities on yoga. 

Inner Engineering gives you the opportunity to intellectually explore the ABC’s of life using methods that are the distilled essence of the yogic sciences. The course imparts practical wisdom to manage your body, mind, emotions, and the fundamental life energy within.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ooFAmT4n89Y

 Inner Engineering Benefits - A Family Physician Shares her Experience:  
(See more on the IE Youtube Channel)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3ZRs69hpNB0

Today's Experiences:  Live Reviews from Inner Engineering Participants


Who is Sadhguru?...   

“A world full of love, light and laughter; its time has come. Let us make it happen.” - Sadhguru 

Renowned for his powerful programs and humanitarian initiatives, Isha Foundation founder, Sadhguru is a realized yogi, mystic, and visionary who tirelessly works for the wellbeing of all. Sadhguru has been hosted to speak and offer guided meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress. 

Isha Foundation has offered the immense benefits of classical yoga and meditation to over 7 million people over the last 30 years. Isha's US-based meditation and yoga retreat center, Isha Institute of Inner-sciences (iii), is located on 1400 breathtaking acres of Tennessee's spectacular Cumberland Plateau.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o1PSNvu3JNc

Isha Institute of Inner-sciences - A Serene Mountain Getaway to Learn Classical Yoga and Meditation 

Relax and Rejuvenate at Isha's Yoga Retreat Center— 

The Isha Institute of Inner-sciences is a breathtaking mountain yoga retreat providing stress relief, rejuvenation and outdoor recreation just 45 minutes outside of Chattanooga, Tennessee. The retreat is a world-class yoga center offering classical yoga and meditation classes from beginner to advanced levels. Guests journey from around the globe to visit this unique destination to relax, reflect, and reconnect within at this tranquil oasis nestled in Tennessee’s spectacular Upper Cumberland!

Drop-by for a Day Visit

The Isha retreat center offers campus tours daily that include light hikes to one of many beautiful bluff vistas or waterfalls and a visit inside the largest yoga and meditation hall in the western hemisphere! Free guided meditation sessions are available each day, offering guests an 18-minute meditation practice called ‘Isha Kriya’ that participants can take home and do on their own. Isha Kriya is a gentle practice for anyone age 12 or older.

Hiking and Mountain Biking on Pristine Forested Trails

The Isha yoga retreat center also offers myriad opportunities for hiking and mountain biking on forested trails winding throughout its nearly 1400 acres. The yoga center's five miles of mountain biking trails have been professionally classified from beginner to intermediate skill levels, with steep climbs, water features, and tight switchbacks on the more challenging portions of the bike trail. The trails are part of an expanding network of over 15 miles of hiking and biking trails featuring beautiful waterfalls, a meandering spring-fed creek, and breathtaking bluff overlooks.

Relaxation & Wellness Retreats

Overnight stays include the option of private studio accommodations, delicious vegetarian buffet meals, and beginner-level yoga classes of the visitor`s choice, such as the 'yoga of sound', yoga for strengthening the joints, and yoga for purifying life energies.  Extended retreat packages feature Ayurvedic rejuvenation consultations and therapies; guided hikes and outdoor adventure outings to nearby caves, rivers and falls; and even vegetarian cooking classes to bring home some of your favorite vegetarian delights!  Learn how to mix the pungent, tangy spices of the East, culture farm-fresh milk into yogurt, roll vegetarian sushi, or bake homemade sourdough bread in the Isha center's popular international, vegetarian kitchen.

For more information on Isha yoga retreats and meditation programs at iii, visit: Visiting Isha Retreat  
For programs nationwide, visit: Isha Yoga Programs 

Connect: 
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/IshaUSA   
IshaUSA - Blog - http://www.ishaUSA.org/blog 
Twitter - https://twitter.com/IshaUSA 
YouTube - http://www.youtube.com/user/ishainnerengineering 
Pinterest - http://pinterest.com/source/ishausa.org/ 

Isha New England is a local non-profit that serves the metro-Boston, the Seacoast and Worcester areas. It has been based in Chelmsford, MA since 2007.

However, I am moving to Southie, I have never lived in Southie before. I thought why not find a group of girls to explore South Boston spots, hang out in Southie and have fun! I figure we can have weekly dinners, coffee meet ups, brunch on Sundays, girls night out at some of the cool local spots and of course we can venture into the city.

Talk about running and scaling start-up engineering organizations, technology choices/challenges, resource challenges.

results.description: Nectar is a non-verbal dance inspired by conscious and ecstatic dance. It is a space to enjoy and explore embodiment, physical expression, and the body’s wisdom. After an opening unguided warm-up period, a playlist of music progresses through a wave—beginning spacious and mellow, gaining intensity, and arriving back into stillness. Participants are welcome to move, dance, and be still as their bodies desire. Nectar opens and closes with intentional circles. Opening circles feature inspirational comments on a theme by the Facilitator-DJ, and closing circles offer participants a chance to share about their experiences in the dance. Nectar was created by Amorn O'Connor and Harrison Blum, and is supported by a rotating crew of Facilitator-DJs.
results.name: Nectar: A Conscious Dance Gathering

results.description: League of Legends is a great game, but the soloqueue experience is crap. If you want to avoid the raging Q.Qs of the soloqueue grind, join this meetup and find like-minded people in your area who want to pair up or even form full-made teams! The main focus of this group is to band together fellow league enthusiasts. I don't know if we can manage actual LAN parties (there aren't too many suitable venues around boston) but we can at the very least meet up online. If all goes well I can invite peeps over to my house to play.
results.name: Boston League of Legends

results.description:
Welcome to Adventurers of North Metro West! This group is intended for fun people who are in the age bracket 25-30's looking to get to know others in their area. Some activities might include trivia, karaoke, bowling, game nights, dancing, wine tasting, brewery tours, hiking, bonfires and much more. We will have weeknight and weekend meet-ups. Adventurers of N. Metro West is co-orgranized by Rachel and Justine.

Suggesting Events: We love new and exciting ideas from our members! If you have an idea, please message Justine and Rachel personally first. We like to gain as much information as possible to see if the event is a good fit. In order to become an event host, you must be a committed member to the group and have attended several events before we send you off on your own. We currently have four event hosts. Sarah D. enjoys hosting coffee and bar meet-ups. Tom enjoys hosting monthly restaurant meet-ups. Jami and Mike like a variety of events including kayaking, ice cream and karaoke!

Common Courtesy Policy: If you decide to RSVP "yes" to an event, please keep your commitment. A lot of planning goes into these events. We understand that things do come up. If you must cancel, please give more than 24 hour notice before an event. We would appreciate a reason why, but it is not necessary. If you do not show up to an event after you RSVP "yes" or change your RSVP to "no" more than twice without notice, you may be removed from the group. This is not meant to be harsh, but a gentle reminder to be courteous. We respect members who are committed and active in our community.

Community Funded: Our MeetUp is community funded by donations from our members. With these donations, we pay for our annual fees to run the MeetUp group, use funds to supply you with fun activities, and keep a reserve for other future events. Each summer we have an annual fundraising barbecue to raise money to fund our group. We appreciate donations at anytime! If you would like to donate, please click the "chip in" button on the desktop version of meetup.com. Thank you for being awesome!

Please make your profile picture of YOU! We like to know what you look like before an event so we know who to look for. Please subscribe to organizer emails. We send out an email 24 hours before an event to make sure you know all of the important details,

We do not tolerate any harassment of any kind. If you feel you are being harassed, please contact an organizer immediately.
results.name: Adventurers of N. Metro West 25-30's

Do you live in the Brookline, Brighton, Allston area? 

Do you like discovering favorite local restaurants, local hot spots and meeting new people? 

Do you want to network with interesting people your age? 

Our community is for you! We are a local community of 20's and 30's professionals who are active, fun and adventurous. Sometimes we'll dine at favorite local restaurants, other times we'll play tennis at a local tennis court. We are a popular community that emphasizes: Great variety. Good times. Inclusivity! 

Some of you may recognize me. I am also the entrepreneur and executive director of the Boston Volunteers, one of Boston's most well respected nonprofits. 

Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org

results.description:
We would love to welcome you to be a part of Oh Baby! Fitness. We offer fitness classes for expecting moms and new moms with their babies on the south shore in Massachusetts. Exercising during pregnancy is one of the best things you can do for your changing body. It helps your mind as well as your body. We offer pregnancy water aerobics classes in a heated pool at Webb's Pro Fitness in Norwell.  Let us help you feel your best during pregnancy. 


For moms who have recently had babies and babies up to a year, we want to help you get your body back while exercising with your baby. We offer mom and baby pool class at Healthtrax in Hanover and at Plymouth Fitness in Plymouth. Join us for a great pool workout while your baby rides alongside in a pool float. At Webb's Pro Fitness, we also offer mom and baby fitness classes. Mom's wear their baby in a front carrier while getting a fabulous workout in.

In the spring we will be adding outside stroller classes!
results.name: Oh Baby! Fitness exercise classes on the South Shore, MA

results.description: This group is for all Doodle varieties, be it Labradoodle, Goldendoodle, or anything in between! We have a Goldendoodle ourselves, and several doodles in daycare with us every week. They're sweethearts with lots of energy and we want to give them a space to play with their curly and furry brothers and sisters! We'll plan on meeting once a month at our daycare facility Big Dog Walkin' in Brighton, MA. Once it gets warmer outside hopefully we can have some meetups at nearby dog parks.
results.name: Doodle Daze

results.description:
The Dedham School of Music cordially invites you (and your friends!) to join us for a growing series of Acoustic Jams and musical events. We rent "The Classroom" at the Mother Brook Arts and Community Center (the old Avery School), 123 High Street, Dedham Massachusetts and use our space to play, promote and enjoy music in all its forms. Check back for additional events . . . we are programming more events growing month by month!!!

ON VACATION -Join us 7:00 - 9:00 pm for our monthly "4th Sunday Acoustic Freestyle Jam." This FREESTYLE Jam is for folks who like a wide music palette (rock, jazz, swing, etc.) and who enjoy playing flute, clarinet, brass and wind instruments. The "4th Sundays" Jam is deliberately and unabashedly freestyle: from the Beatles and the Boswell Sisters to The Box Tops, Dan Hicks, gospel and acapella, the loose structure of the "4th Sundays Acoustic Freestyle Jam" is designed for singing and playing music in all its forms.

For those who love Bluegrass music we have two possibilities for you.

ON VACATION  - The first is "Really Strictly Bluegrass" held the 3rd Friday of every month. Suitable for intermediate or advanced Bluegrass jammers, this Jam welcomes those playing traditional stringed Bluegrass acoustic instruments like mandolin, guitar, banjo and fiddle. We do traditional Bluegrass songs to start our weekend. 

For novice players or those who want to start learning Bluegrass we offer a Bluegrass SLOW JAM the third Tuesday of every month from 7:30 - 9:00 pm. Taught by longtime Bluegrass performer George Chapman, we sloooowly play through  simple traditional Bluegrass songs, offering guidance and encouragement as we go. We make this the safest possible place to get comfortable playing with others.  Players of all levels are welcome and we take special care to provide guidance for beginners and casual musicians. 

All our Jams are free . . . we "pass the hat" to help cover our rent and expenses.

topics.name: The Open Web Application Security Project

results.description:
The Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) is a 501(c)(3) worldwide not-for-profit charitable organization focused on improving the security of software. Our mission is to make software security visible, so that individuals and organizations worldwide can make informed decisions about true software security risks.

Everyone is free to participate in OWASP and all of our materials are available under a free and open software license. You'll find everything about OWASP here on or linked from our wiki and current information on our OWASP Blog. OWASP does not endorse or recommend commercial products or services, allowing our community to remain vendor neutral with the collective wisdom of the best minds in software security worldwide. We ask that the community look out for inappropriate uses of the OWASP brand including use of our name, logos, project names and other trademark issues. We usually meet the FIRST WEDNESDAY of EVERY MONTH (Unless a speaker can only present another night), 6:30 to 9 pm. Everyone is welcome to come to any meeting, there is no signup or joining criteria, just come if it sounds interesting. Feel free to sign up to the OWASP Boston mailing list.


Any questions or comments, tweet us at @owaspboston or email us!
results.name: OWASP Open Web Application Security Project Boston

results.description:
Good times aren’t as cheap as they used to be. If you’re the type of person that prefers quality over quantity, then this group is for you!

You don’t have to be a millionaire to enjoy the finer things in life. All events will cost a minimum of $25 and a maximum of $200. In some cases we give you a chance to get something off of your bucket list. Whenever possible, we will negotiate group rates, to put together unforgettable experiences at a significant savings.

Join with confidence, we’re part of a network of many other groups with over 10,000 unique members! We’re planning out a fantastic 2014, so join us now for some once-in-a-lifetime experiences!

Here are a few things we’re working on:

• Skydiving
• Blue Man Group
• Cirque du Soleil
• Other theatrical performances
• Drive a Lamborghini / NASCAR on a closed track
• Helicopter Tours
• Bungee jumping
• Hotel & upscale lounges
• Limos & party bus rentals
• Wine Tours
• Casinos
• Wine Expos
• Fine dining
• Red Sox / Patriots / Bruins
• VIP tables
• Snowmobiles
• Jetskis
• ATV’s

Join with confidence, we’re part of a network of many other groups with over 10,000 unique members!

Code of conduct:

1. It is CRITICAL that you keep your RSVP’s up to date. It creates false expectations of our members, puts vendor relationships at risk, and is just plain rude. So please use that cute red button. It only takes a second. If you can't go in the first place, do nothing.

2. Contacting other members prior to meeting them is seriously frowned upon. This isn't Match.com or a career website. Members leave the group and will never attend an event because of this behavior.

3. While at an event, treat our members AND the staff of venues with respect. Tip your bartenders/waitstaff and don’t drink too much Your behavior has an affect on all of us.

results.description:
This is a group focused on LGBTQ culture, heritage, social issues, and politics from a Russian and Eastern European perspective. 

Originally focused on Russian-Speaking LGBTQ individuals, we welcome progressive people who identify with and support Russian LGBTQ culture and heritage. We welcome everyone who has ties to Russian (and neighbors) LGBTQ communities to join us. 

Our activities have included social action around the Sochi Olympics, a gender and sexuality conference, wine tasting, meals, and local happenings (like the Dyke March).  Most events use English as the dominant language. 

This is the Boston branch of RUSA LGBT Meetup group located in New York City. Anyone from Boston area or visiting from another state or another country is welcome to attend.

Let's celebrate our identity and fight for diversity, social justice, human and civil rights for LGBTQ people everywhere we live. Let’s join together in creating a social network and community united by common culture.

Bring along your family, friends and significant others. Let's get together, hang out, share our stories, have fun and create a Russian-and-friends LGBTQ community along the way. We are single, we are couples, we are parents, we have parents, sisters and brothers - we are just like you!

Tell us a few words about yourself. Our approval process is quick and easy. We are very friendly bunch and our meetups are a lot of fun. Go ahead and join us. We hope to meet you soon!

We also invite you to join us on Facebook - www.facebook.com/rusa.lgbt.

topics.name: Getting Unstuck and Out of Your Own Way!

results.description:
Are you a writer? A self employed business owner who works from home? A blogger? A grad student with a dissertation to finish? Do you find that when you work from home, distractions have a way of sabotaging the time you try to set aside (even self induced ones like Facebook and email checking)? Do you find yourself battling with procrastination every week? 

This Meetup is for people who want to have a designated block of 2 hours (or more) a week to focus on uninterrupted writing or other work. We have different days, times and places we gather. 

The idea is to bring your laptop or whatever you need for your work. Come 15 or 30 minutes early to get your coffee, say hello to each other and settle in --- then there's a start time when we agree to finish up the social chat and get down to our respective work intentions for the meetup time. The simple, supportive presence of each other makes for good connection & accountability. 


My name is Katrina. Being self employed, I always welcome a little structure for self-accountability and procrastination management. I often do my work in coffee shops anyway - perhaps you do too? 

That's why I started this Meetup. Thought it would be a great way to commit to showing up and working in a focused way every week. Also a nice way to make some new friends and connections. If you're looking to structure a time to work for yourself... I invite you to join us. 

Important Note: (please read) We do ask that you, please, only sign up if you are serious about using this as focused (read: quiet) work time. 

Our opportunity for enjoying social, conversation time happens before and after our official self-work hours. 

Any questions - feel free to ask!
results.name: A Time for Work

results.description:
CALLING ALL CHRISTIANS, YOUNG AND NOT-SO-YOUNG :-), NEW AND SEASONED IN THE FAITH:

God so loved the world that He gave His only begotten Son.  Jesus Christ so loved us that he laid down his life for us.  He came that we might “have and enjoy life, and have it in abundance (to the full, till it overflows).”  [John 10:10 from The Amplified Bible]  He died for us so we could live for Him.  It’s our time to let the Son shine in our lives…and to have fun along the way! 

Our meetups are informal, non-denominational gatherings focused on practical Christianity.  Some of our meetups are Bible studies which include brief, powerful, and practical teachings from God’s Word.  Other activities we enjoy together include game and movie nights, dining in and out, dancing, bicycling, community walks, music in the park, field trips to local attractions, city excursions, etc.

Our goal is to encourage each other in our efforts to learn, live, and give the light of God’s Word.  We want people to see how awesome God is and that His Word works every time we believe it. 

Some scriptures that guide and inspire us are (visit the "pages" tab for the full text of these verses):

Matthew 5:14 and 16

II Corinthians 5:14 and 15

I John 1:4 and 5

Hebrews 10:23-25

results.description:
Are you a budding actor and/or filmmaker?

Got a scene you're working on?

Need a place to air out your creative process? 

In this group you will find:

- a place to run scenes you are working on for auditions, films, and theater projects.

-  a supportive, creative environment in which to work on developing your own methods and process as a filmmaker and/or actor.

- the opportunity to observe and learn from others.

- a chance to act in or direct scenes.

If you plan on coming, please RSVP, and bring:

Scripted material you want to work on, 3-5 pages max, or something comparable. Don't forget copies for the people you may want to read for you. Or just show up and improvise a scene you've been thinking about. Or just show!!

Most scene study groups charge $60.00 or more.

The cost here is $5.00  

Also, please be aware that this is not a group critique, and that we divide up the time as evenly as possible for people to get a chance to work on their own thing. When it's your turn, you are in charge of your time - so please feel free to be explicit with the group about what sort of assistance/ feedback you want or don't want. When the times up we keep it rolling along to the next scene..

Look forward to seeing you there!

Best, 
Robert

results.description:
Mission:

Women Who Code is a global nonprofit organization dedicated to inspiring women to excel in technology careers by creating a global, connected community of women in technology. The organization tripled in 2013 and has grown to be one of the largest communities of women engineers in the world.

Empowerment:

Women Who code is a professional community for women in tech. We provide an avenue for women to pursue a career in technology, help them gain new skills and hone existing skills for professional advancement, and foster environments where networking and mentorship are valued.

Key Initiatives:

Free technical study groups

Events featuring influential tech industry experts and investors

Hack events

Career and leadership development

Current and aspiring coders are welcome. 

Bring your laptop and a friend! 

Support Women Who Code:

Donating to Women Who Code, Inc. (#46-4218859) directly impacts our ability to efficiently run this growing organization, helps us produce new programs that will increase our reach, and enables us to expand into new cities around the world ensuring that women and girls everywhere have the opportunity to pursue a career in technology.

Women Who Code (WWCode) is dedicated to providing an empowering experience for everyone who participates in or supports our community, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, ability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion, or socioeconomic status. Because we value the safety and security of our members and strive to have an inclusive community, we do not tolerate harassment of members or event participants in any form. Our Code of Conduct applies to all events run by Women Who Code, Inc. If you would like to report an incident or contact our leadership team, please submit an incident report form.

WomenWhoCode.com

Twitter | Facebook | Blog

results.description:
Rough Draft Sketch, also known as #RDVSketch, is a monthly Meetup that pulls together university students from around the Boston area to discuss the pains and pleasures of starting and running technology startups. Each #RDVSketch features a panel of thought leaders, entrepreneurs, and innovators from around the world, all interested in helping tomorrow's leaders soak up the knowledge needed to succeed in founding new, world-changing ventures.

#RDVSketch is sponsored by Rough Draft Ventures, a student partnership investing at the earliest stage in student startups, to help them in their journey from rough drafts to products in markets. General Catalyst Partners is a co-founder and funder of our initiative. The students who are part of Rough Draft Ventures are passionate, smart, driven technologists who are already catalyzing entrepreneurial activity on their campuses.
results.name: #RDVSketch Student Entrepreneurs Meetup

topics.name: Adults Taking Care of Aging Parents

results.description:
Who we are

We are a group of baby boomers, family members and working adults caring for elderly parents, sick or injured spouses, neighbors, friends and other loved ones. We want to succeed in this role while maintaining our own lives and wellness.

What we do

As givers of care, many of us need support but often do not qualify for publicly-funded support programs yet are not fortunate enough to afford private help, private care management services and guidance on an ongoing, private pay basis (out-of-pocket). Our goal is to get together, support each other and get affordable group-based support, advice and guidance. We'll meet in person once a month to exchange information, learn and practice critical skills, get our questions answered, hear from experts, see practical demos, share tips and ideas, discuss solutions to common and new challenges, share reviews, get advice on maintaining our own wellness and sanity, discuss any issues of concern, explore useful strategies, organize day trips, nights-out, movies, games, dinner … and anything else that looks like fun. We'll shape the agenda together and look forward to meeting you.

To RSVP for our next event or make suggestions, go to http://www.meetup.com/www-boomergiv­ersofcare-org/
results.name: Boomers & Working Adults Caring for Parents & Spouses

Annual Dues: $25

results.description:
Please read this entire page prior to joining New England Dog Friendly Day Trips, Getaways, Gatherings.


This group is for dog lovers who would like:

- Weekend getaways with your dog

-Attending day trips that are dog friendly

- Exploring New England with your furry friend

-Socializing with others that love their dog

-Participating in fun dog friendly events

 -Or just spend an afternoon together


If you are like me, your dog is a very important part of your life.

I love to be outdoors and exploring new places, but most meetups that I belong to don't offer a lot of dog friendly excursions. Through my research I have found many great places to go, events to attend, and overnight getaways to participate in with my faithful companion. Join us on some of these adventures!

Only well behaved, socialized dogs and their humans are welcome to join. If you like the company of dogs ( and their humans) and don't have a dog in your life at the moment, you are welcome to join us as well.

Please post a current photo of you, or you and your dog, so that we can recognize you at an event!

If you are a no-show on 2 or more events, you will be removed from the group. Simply update your RSVP if you cannot attend, so that someone else can attend. A no-show is when you do not attend an event that you RSVP'd yes for, and do not change your RSVP to indicate that you will not attend.

Rules:

1)If you choose to let your dog(s) off-leash, you are responsible for the dog's actions according to the terms of the Liability Waiver. You also agree to be responsible for any fines that may be incurred due to a breach of rules of the organization owning or responsible for the meetup location.

2) Dogs are expected to be well behaved and under owner control at all times. This group is for well socialized dogs only! We are not the venue for dogs that are learning how to socialize! The Meetup organizer reserves the right to remove or limit participation of members in any event due to a members inability to control their dogs behavior, including excessive barking, making others in the group feel uncomfortable in any way, aggressive behavior, or any behavior that exhibits lack of control of the dog, or causes another dog to feel unsafe.

If your dog barks excessively, any restaurant  event may not be appropriate for your dog. Let's face it! All dogs will bark! Barking within reason is expected!  Excessive barking is when your dog continues to bark and will not stop even when you use a voice command to attempt to stop his/her barking. Please be prepared to remove your dog from the event, if you cannot control his/her barking. It is not fair to other patrons of the establishment who are trying to enjoy the venue as well. We want to be invited back to a chosen venue, and do not want to jeopardize that in any way!

If your dog has an incident of aggressive behavior, causes other dogs or people in the group to feel uncomfortable in an way, you will be removed from the group.

3) You agree to take personal and financial responsibility for any damages to property, people or other dog(s) caused by your dog(s) or any dog(s) you have brought to the meetup.


4) By becoming a member of this group, you are confirming that your dog does not have any history of behavioral issues or aggressiveness.

5) Dogs must be leashed at all times. Retractable leashes,shock collars, choke collars are not allowed. Any type of restraining collar is not permitted. If your dog needs a shock collar or choke collar, this group is not for you and your dog. Off leash walks are not encouraged.

6) This meetup is about having fun and meeting new friends. Please be kind and respectful of others at all times. I am not responsible for the actions of others, and cannot be held responsible for members actions. Any complaint about an individual will result in removal from the group.

7) Please understand that this is a public meetup group. We take lots of photos and add them to the Meetup site. Please let us know in advance if you do not want to be photographed.

8) No solicitations, advertisements, postings of items for sale, or promotions of any kind are allowed by members without the consent of the organizer. Members in violation will be removed.

9) In order to participate in any overnight trip, you must be current with member dues, and have attended 2-3 day trips prior to the overnight trip.

10) Please be respectful and pick up after your dog at all times.

11) Your dog must be over 2 years old to participate in events.

12) By joining this group, you are confirming that your dog is up to date on all shots and or titers, is healthy, and is spayed/neutered.

Liability Release - In order to join and or participate in this meetup group, you agree  :  to hold harmless the organizer and her heirs, and all members and participants of this Meetup group and their heirs, from any and all claims of injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and or any other reasons. You also agree to assume all psychological , physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. All meetup activities pose assumed risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.


            Let's start exploring New England with our faithful companions!
results.name: New England Dog Friendly Day Trips, Getaways, Gatherings

results.description:
Our mission is to help you succeed as an entrepreneur through education, actionable advice, and a supportive community.


Why did we start this?: 

Our passion is making stuff. Physical stuff. In our pursuit of creating physical goods, we realized that Boston / Cambridge / Somerville does not quite have the same resources for consumer goods as it does for other industries. So, we are helping to create these resources.

More so, it can be a lonely road in the early days of building a company.  That's why we want to ignite the community together.

Let's go make some cool shit!


Learn more here: www.BuildingConsumerGoods.com

results.description:
Our group is open and friendly to everyone interested in triathlon training or one of the following: Swimming, road biking, or running. Let's be real - what beats a group that gets a bunch of people together in speedos and bike shorts? This is a great group for people interested in exercise, especially those who are training for road races (such as 5k, 10k, half-marathon, marathon), bike rides, swim competitions, or triathlons such as the annual August Boston Triathlon. It's also a social group for people to meet other GLBT athletes in the area! 

Here are some examples of past meetups: A six-mile Charles River run loop, a four-mile South Boston beach loop followed by a beer at a pub, a bike ride along the Minuteman Bikepath from Cambridge to Bedford, a 40-mile bike ride and swim to Walden pond, a one-hour swim workout at a local pool followed by dinner, and an open water swim at Pleasure Bay in South Boston.

 Looking forward to meeting everyone! Please suggest this to any of your friends that are interested in running, biking, and swimming.
results.name: Boston LGBT Triathlon Group (Swimmers, Cyclists, or Runners)

results.description:
We are a small community of photographers who meet regularly to sharpen our eye, our instincts and our technical skill with improvisational challenges. Improv Photo outings take place on the second Sunday of every month, with additional 'get out and shoot' outings throughout the year. 

At each outing, we meet briefly to talk photography and introduce newcomers before getting a one or two word prompt and heading out to find images inspired by that prompt. After an hour of shooting, we meet again to share images and talk about the challenge. 

Prompts are open-ended to facilitate creativity, and outings are a great opportunity to experiment with different techniques, cameras or gear.  Our members use everything from full-frame cameras to iPhones, and work with color, black and white, film or digital. The only requirement is to pack light so you can wander & shoot with ease. 

***To maintain an active community, this meetup has a membership fee of $5 per year, payable in person or through the meetup system. New members have a 60 day grace period to attend meetings before deciding whether to officially join the group. (Improv Outings are always free.) ***
results.name: Boston Improvisational Photography

results.description:
This photography group is open to all photographers and models interested in developing their in studio lighting abilities and techniques for glamour, portrait, modeling, artistic or any other modified lighting situation. We schedule workshops regularly ranging from beginner lighting instruction to portraits in motion such as ballet. We also schedule an artistic workshop monthly with a guest model.  These are strictly artistic and involve advanced lighting techniques to produce specific effects complementary to the workshops theme which varies with each session .

An exciting feature to this group is our sponsor studio, Studio Imaging 637, which enables us to utilize a large number of first rate lighting strobes, studio props and sets. We are able to tackle many studio photo projects not normally available to photographers or models because of this. We also at times run activities in tandem with RiversEdge Photographic Society which also meets at the studio. 

We are an adventurous and creative group....we are an active group!  Join accordingly!
results.name: MERRIMACK VALLEY STUDIO PHOTOGRAPHY

results.description:
Driven by the motivation to predict, influence and create the future, Boston Futurists seek to take the best this city has to offer in terms of its diverse investment in technology, science, ecommerce and the arts. Let's gather together and forge a new direction, and have a fun time doing it! 


On the first weekend of the month from 1pm - 3pm, we have an event based meetup where we demo cutting edge technology or listen to speakers who work in future related fields.


On the third Tuesday of the month from 7:30pm - 9pm, we have a discussion about trends and topics related to future studies. This is a great time to get to know our group and gives everyone an opportunity to think and discuss the future.

 

There is a subreddit reddit.com/r/BostonFuturists to work in parallel with this community, and a much larger subreddit dedicated to future studies - reddit.com/r/Futurology!
results.name: Boston Futurist Society

We'll meet for events that cover graduate school life, transitioning into full-time careers, and just relaxing with new friends.

results.description:
Welcome, and thank you for stopping by!

This group was created to promote Catholic fellowship, and celebrate the blessed gift of Christ in the Eucharistic.  Deo Gratius. <br>

<br>

This group hopes to connect Catholics, for social fellowship... fellowship which of course might incorporate our faith.  Eucharistic Adoration seemed to be a subject which might bring that goal into focus.  

Of course, adoration is a quiet time. It is not conducive to social interactions. So, my thoughts are that maybe we could find a way to incorporate adoration into some other sorts of social activities.  Perhaps we would meet for a short adoration either before or after the activity.

What sort of activity? Well, some ideas might include:

• Short pilgrimages to local shrines

• Attending Mass at a parish we might not have been to before

• Attending movies (faith related) together

• Perhaps organizing more adventurous trips, like to the national shrine in DC

<br>

May God's blessings be with you; May the peace and mercy of his only son, Jesus Christ, fill your heart; and may the joy and wisdom of his Holy Spirit guide your every step, this day and always!

<br>

<br>

http://youtu.be/ASHEyV8Wr4U
results.name: Eucharistic Adoration Group of New England

results.description: The Boston entrepreneurship scene is rich in events and networking opportunities for tech and life science startups, but needs a home for social entrepreneurs to collaborate, network, and learn. Enter, Boston Social Business! BSB will convene educational and networking events geared towards entrepreneurs launching new social enterprises. We will focus on the unique challenges faced by those looking to weave social responsibility into the fabric of their companies from day one, not as an afterthought.
results.name: Boston Social Business- for Social Enterprise Startups!

results.description:
We run a FREE Women's Self Defense Program every Saturday at 10:00 AM, at our 16 000 Sq Ft Self Defense Studio in Charlestown. We teach the SEPS (Situation Effective Protection System) approach to Self-Defense & Self-Protection that teaches and empowers individuals how to predict, identify and avoid violence. Rather than teach a set of safety tips, and well meant good advice, we teach people how to make dynamic risk assessments of the situations they face and how to make correct and appropriate personal safety decisions. Our system is based on academic research and real world experiences of those working in the security industry.

For more information please go to: www.womensselfdefenseboston.com

We use Krav Maga Yashir techniques for the physical component of the system. Krav Maga is the system of close combat that is taught to members of the IDF (Israeli Defense Forces), and is based on instinctive, reflexive and natural movements that are quick and easy to learn.
results.name: Women's Self Defense Boston

results.description:

This group is to learn about using Firebase in web and mobile application development. The point of this group is to help each other progress in our projects, not to just sit back and listen to guest speakers.

Firebase is a powerful API to store and sync data in realtime and has full-featured libraries for all major web and mobile platforms and bindings for the most popular frameworks.

We will have speakers, demos, lightning talks, workshops and socializing to help connect our members and help each other. 

Come brainstorm ideas, share insights, and exchange feedback on your apps, and most of all, make progress.


@FirebaseCamb is our twitter handle.

results.description:
WE ARE NOT A CHRISTIAN SINGLES DATING MEETUP.  

We want to get this out there in case you are looking for a group that is geared towards this. They are plenty of good ones doing this. So read on about who we are if you are okay with us not organized for those looking to meet your next partner.


We are Christians at Work seeking to honor God through our choice of work. 

We explore difficult questions:

How do we give God glory in our work?

How do we elevate work above only earning a salary?

How do we spread the Gospel by our actions and words when performing our duties?

How do we sanctify work that is toilsome and challenging and low paying?

What roles do faith, prayer and perseverance play when our work is more a duty than a labor of love?

How do we know when we are working for the glory of God and not just for the glory of our selves and to feed our insatiable appetites for material possessions?

How do we stay faithful to our duty when God says "stay" but we want to leave?

How do we leave in faith and in obedience to God when fear tells us stay because we can't see the future?

Are we living out, and how so, the command to return a tithe offering of resources, time and talent?

We are also about day-to-day realities like unhappiness and challenges on the job; difficult colleagues and superiors and how to leave when staying is unhealthy emotionally, physically and spiritually or staying when we have no choice. 

Where other groups focus on growing membership and define success by its numbers our focus is on small group intimacy, integrity, safety, confidentiality and encouragement and support. 

Before joining us we ask you to read and reflect on our guidelines and to consider whether you can commit to them.   

 

Meetup Guidelines for creating a Sacred Space:

Honor ~ Honor God and each other by our choice of words, manners and actions.

Disclosure ~ Disclosing if you have an association with a present member and whether that is through a referral by a present member or an external source. 

Confidentiality ~ We best exemplify our Christian values by keeping our conversations confidential when we part.

Respect ~ Treat each other with respect even in disagreement. Respecting the right/choice of each member to share or be an active listener. No one is REQUIRED OR INVITED to share unless he/she so desires. 

Sharing ~ Give our attention to the member speaking and likewise to receive the full attention of the group when speaking.  Sidebar conversation when others are speaking is considered rude and disrespectful.

Time ~ Speak concisely so as to give other members an opportunity to speak/share without interruption.


If these are guidelines you can adhere to, our group is happy to welcome you and look forward to meeting you. 

We welcome workers from all backgrounds; those who are happily employed and those not so happily; those nearing retirement; those in transition discerning a new career and those now entering the workforce or returning to it after a break. 

So now that you have learned who we are and what we are about, you may have decided to join us and " Commit your work to the LORD."  Proverbs 16:3.  

If you have joined us - Welcome!
results.name: Christians at Work for the Glory of God

results.description:
Boston 1 is a non-profit dragon boat club in Boston. We are always looking for people to join season round!

We're a crew of fun young international people who are young professionals and students who all share a love for paddling. Boston 1 is a team that balances a fun social atmosphere with a competitive edge - a family away from home where we encourage friendship, support and physical fitness. 


Schedule

During the summer season we paddle together 3 times a week (Mon/Wed 6-8pm, Sat 11am-1pm) at Fort Point Channel. We also race in regional dragon boat race festivals about 4 times over the course of the summer. We treat race events like road trips: driving with friends around the North-east, paddling competitively, having adventures, eating, drinking and getting to know each other better!

In the winter off-season we continue to workout together. Our strength coach has designed a winter weight lifting program and you get personal training from the coaches!


Prices

New paddler 2-class pack for $10. All other paddlers paddle unlimited under the $110 annual membership fee. New paddlers who decide to join get a $10 deduction from membership! Annual membership covers the start of the water season 2015 all the way through winter of 2015/2016.


What to expect

Dragon boat is an athletic sport. We aren't going for a lazy sight-seeing paddle. Your heart will be pumping, you will get sweaty, you will get splashed, you will have a lot of fun.  We work hard together so that we can race strong and be proud of our efforts. Do expect to get a good workout with some impressive beasts on the boat, but most importantly, we do all this in a non-judgemental and welcoming environment. All fitness levels are welcome.


Social Stuff

The team also comes together at social events that are organized throughout the year (long bike rides, bowling, pub nights, pot lucks, winter ski retreats and end-of-year banquets). 

Come try our club out, we welcome new members at all times of the year. No prior experience necessary! For more information on our team or the next practice, check us out on www.boston1.org, or email us if you have questions boston1.dboat@gmail.com

1 crew, 1 family, 1 goal!

http://youtu.be/8cS_t0YQ0bw


Admin Stuff

Please sign our e-Waiver before you get on the water: http://bit.ly/Boston1Waiver

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in twitter, facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts here: http://bit.ly/JoinBoston1

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook


Attendance and Racing expectations

We understand your busy lives and many responsibilities. We encourage our paddlers to attend as many practices as possible, especially around race meets. Attending race meets are not a requirement...but racing is a ton of fun and very addictive.
results.name: Boston 1 Dragon Boat Team

results.description:
Join us for weekly practice in Boston just a couple of blocks from the Tuffs Medical Center Orange Line T station on Washington Street. Our practice is 90 minutes of traditional Japanese karate with direct lineage to Gichin Funakoshi and includes kihon, kumite and kata. Practitioners of all levels are welcome. You will receive the highest caliber instruction. Come experience Boston’s best kept secret!

Practice is on Mondays and Thursdays from 7:15 – 9.00 P.M. and Saturdays from 10:15 A.M. to Noon.

Karate-do is the Way of the Empty Hand. It is derived from the ancient Okinawan fighting style and heavily influenced by the Chinese martial arts. The style of karate we practice is the traditional Shotokan as practiced from the time of Gichin Funakoshi. We are affiliated with Shotokan Karate of America (SKA).

Master Gichin Funakoshi introduced karate-do to mainland Japan in 1916. He had been initiated into all the major Okinawan karate methods and taught a synthesis of the Okinawan styles as a total discipline. This method became known as Shotokan. Because of the great popularity of the style in Japan and, later, around the world, Funakoshi is widely considered to be the “father of modern karate-do. Aside from creating Shotokan karate and introducing it to Japan and the world, Funakoshi Sensei also wrote several books, one of which is “Karate-Do Kyohan” - The Master Text, which is the “handbook” of Shotokan. The original Japanese text of Karate-Do Kyohan was translated into English by Tsutomu Ohshima in 1973.

We practice Shotokan karate in the traditional manner for the development of mind, body, and spirit. This art form has been passed down from teachers to students in an unbroken line from Funakoshi Sensei himself to Ohshima Sensei to us. We believe it is the responsibility of each practitioner to learn and practice the techniques correctly so that the tradition is preserved and can be passed on intact to the next generation.

Shotokan Karate of America is a national nonprofit organization that has been teaching traditional karate-do in the United States since 1955. SKA was founded and is still led by Tsutomu Ohshima, who is one of Master Funakoshi Sensei’s last direct pupils. In 1955 Mr. Ohshima came to the United States and was the first person to teach karate to the U.S. public. To learn more, go to: http://ska.org/about/history-of-karate/.
results.name: Boston Area Shotokan Karate
