results.description:
WARRIORS!

I am so very excited to announce that we will be partnering up with the Boston Area Rape Crisis Center for our April charity series!

Rape and sexual assault impact more people than you think - maybe even someone you know.

In the United States, 1 in 6 women and 1 in 33 men reported experiencing an attempted or completed rape at some time in their lives...

The Boston Area Rape Crisis Center (BARCC) is committed to giving survivors and their families and friends the resources they need to reclaim their lives and begin healing, to raising awareness of the issues survivors face, and to ending sexual violence through healing and social change.

Here at TFW Boston, we have the opportunity to help an amazing cause. I look forward to seeing all of you there!

Saturday April 11, 11:45am-1pm

Address:

33 Harrison Ave.

7th Floor

Boston, MA 02111
results.name: High Intensity Interval Training HIIT For a Cause!

results.description:
[LEND A HELPING HAND]

WARRIORS!! Please take a second to read this...

On January 10th, Nayna's life changed. One of her family members was hit by a car while walking down the street with his 5 year old son...

After 6 days in a coma, he passed away.

He was only 39 years old and a father of two. His wife, Rameelaben, is still learning english, making it very hard for her to support her family.

Nayna has kindly opened her doors, taking care of both children and is helping Rameelaben find work and start a new life....

Every Saturday for the month of February, we are hosting a Charity workout to help raise money for the children's future.

results.description:
Women Outdoors is a national, nonprofit organization whose mission is to provide a supportive environment where all women can have fun and challenge themselves in a community of women who love the outdoors while respecting the earth. Women Outdoors promotes leadership, friendship, adventure and enjoyment in the great outdoors.

An all-volunteer organization, Women Outdoors has regional chapters in states throughout the US, all of which organize activities for members such as hiking, biking, kayaking and cross-country skiing.

To become a member of this Meetup group, you must use a recognizable facial photo of yourself in your profile that we can use to identify you at our events. A positive attitude goes a long way, too!  :)

You can learn more at www.womenoutdoors.org.

Membership Dues - There are NO membership dues to join this Meetup, though donations of any size are gratefully accepted and will go toward an annual outing and party.  Although it does cost to maintain a Meetup group, the national Women Outdoors organization generously subsidizes our cost and hopes you'll consider joining. There are many benefits to joining Women Outdoors, including being eligible to register for The Gathering: our yearly Memorial Day weekend at a wonderful camp in New Hampshire that features kayaking on a pond, hiking in the White Mountains, bicycling to  nearby towns, skills workshops such as orienteering, a rock climbing wall, and much more. Women Outdoors also offers subsidized or full tuition reimbursement for leadership and outdoor skills training, including first aid and kayak trip leading, for example. 

We'll soon have a badge indicating which members of this group are registered members of Women Outdoors.

To read more and join, go to http://womenoutdoors.org/joinus.
results.name: Women Outdoors — Eastern Massachusetts Meetup

topics.name: Meetings other couples who share your interest too
Happy Couples meeting other happy couples

results.description:
Tired of hanging around with friends and family who have negative attitudes about their relationships or relationships in general? Happy Couples is a Meet Up group for couples who respect each other and place a high value on creating stable, loving relationships.

Relationship negativity can be contagious, and is especially uncomfortable to be around if you are consciously working to create harmony in your life. And lets face it, hanging around couples who constantly nag and criticize each other is just a huge drag!! If you are a couple that are in a loving, respectful relationship (or are at least actively trying to achieve that) come hang out with us!

Happy Couples is primarily intended to be a social group. We will get together approximately once per month to do activities like bowling, hiking, dinner/drinks, etc., and to have fun getting to know other happy, positive couples!

Our secondary hope is that, as people get to know each other, group members can act as positive role models for each other and provide support for handling any relationship challenges that members face. However, sharing of this kind is strictly optional and can be done as selectively and privately as you wish.

It should go without saying that self-righteousness, nagging, criticism, and put downs between partners (or towards other couples) is not welcome at these meet-ups, nor is the use of negative gender stereotypes. However, we do welcome couples of all ages, races, religions, cultural and socio-economic backgrounds, and sexual orientations. 

Join us for some couples fun free of unnecessary negativity!!
results.name: Greater Boston Happy Couples

results.description: This is group is for parents and expectant parents of egg and/or sperm donor conceived children (both single and coupled parents, with donor children of any age). I started this group because I just couldn't find any groups to meet other parents raising donor-conceived kids. I'm looking forward to meeting other folks who are in a similar situation (and if you're considering using donor eggs and/or donor sperm to start your family, you're welcome too!). I want this group to be a place of support where we can bring our questions and concerns about parenting donor-conceived children and all of the issues that can bring up--for us and for our children--so that we can make the most of this incredible journey while we raise our miraculous children! ***Please note, our initial meetings will be held in Swampscott, MA (North Shore), but I'm totally open to have it in other locations if any of you are interested in hosting some meetings***
results.name: Parents of Donor Conceived Children

Also, please visit our group's adviser, Scott Edinburgh 

http://www.personalmbacoach.com/



As a former management consultant and a Wharton and MIT graduate, Scott founded Personal MBA Coach in 2008. With a boutique and personalized approach, Scott helps turn analytical, general management and client services experiences into powerful and convincing stories that admissions committee members are looking for. Scott has helped hundreds of applicants get into top MBA programs around the world including HBS, Stanford, Wharton, Chicago Booth, Kellogg, Columbia GSB, Dartmouth Tuck, MIT Sloan, London Business School, INSEAD, Yale SOM, UVA Darden, Duke Fuqua, Berkeley Haas, NYU Stern and many more. Some significant sources of inspiration for our group are the teachings of Lama Willa Miller, Pema Chodron, and Thich Nhat Hanh. We serve the entire Merrimack Valley community and are affiliated with North Parish U.U. 

The following weekly activities are offered free of charge and are open to anyone who would like to drop in: Wed evenings 7:30-9:00 pm Guided Meditation and Discussion; Fri mornings 8:30-9:15 am Silent Sitting and Walking Meditation.

results.description:
Books worth reading. Do you love to read? Do you like to meet to discuss the most recent read?

Get some tips, tools and tricks for finding your next great read!

This new Book group is for people, over the age of 35, interested in meeting to discuss great books at a local restaurant (tavern,cafe) with.

We require that you  provide your real name, a face photo (so we will recognize you at the Meetup events) and, show(unhide) your meet up interests and/or groups (click on “unhide your interests and groups from others” in your Profiles section).

Instead of selecting one book for the group to read, and then discuss, like some book clubs do,  this Book Group is “theme” based.

We will meet at a restaurant, or cafe nearby Burlington, Massachusetts.

Our plan is to schedule a Book club Meet-up once a month, on a Sunday (or Tuesday during the summer) evening. No guests please. Have your guest join the meet-up group (and be approved ) so that they can attend an event.

Some Guidelines:  Keep in mind we are in a public setting when choosing a book. No fifty Shades. To discuss a book whose content is appropriate for a public setting.

Also, no Authors intending to use this meetup to market their books are allowed.
If the book is fiction, when discussing,  the key is not to give away the ending! (spoiler alerts).

We are also open to any Book Meetup themes that you might be interested in. We look forward to having fun and meeting you all!
results.name: The Burlington Book Club, Next Great Read for ages 35+

topics.name: Growing in Intimacy with Jesus Christ

results.description:
This is a no-pressure, non-religious discussion group for anyone interested in exploring and experiencing Jesus. 

Jesus was many things - prophet, teacher, healer, role model, guide and people gatherer. MLK, Jr., Gandhi and the Dali Lama have all cited him as a major influence on their lives. 

A major part of Jesus' life was providing supernatural physical healing and spiritual freedom for people.  He worked miracles like raising the dead and had command over natural elements.  

And he saw the people around them in a way that let them know he cared about them personally. 

On Oct 30th we are exploring the questions: "If Jesus healed back then, does he still do it now?" and "Does he see me and my need?" 

Group meets every Thursday night from Oct 9-Nov 20 (7pm-8:30pm) at 73 Endicott Ave near Teele Sq. Drop in for one night or come for all of them! 

Let's explore and experience one of the most amazing people who's ever lived!
results.name: Conversations about Jesus

results.description:
My motto is "Do Something Creative Every Day!".

I have been a scrapbooker and stamper for about 10 years now.  I started my foray into scrapbooking by attending a Creative Memories workshop and I was hooked!  My style of scrapbooking has changed over the years (can you say Sticker Sneeze?). I now use a combination of digital and tradition scrapping style. I attend scrapbooking retreats a few times a year which gives me the devoted time I need to focus on my albums.

My introduction to stamping began with taking a class at a local paper specialty store, that has now since closed (Ink About It). I fell in love with stamping! I love making hand-made cards and the first person I gave one of my cards to was my wonderful Mother-in-law! She was so appreciative that it really made my day. From there I took many classes and read many blogs to learn all about the different products and techniques that are out there! There are so many!!!

So..... that takes to me today! When I first started stamping, A Muse Artstamps were the first stamps that captured my attention. A Muse had grown over the years and is now know as A Muse Studio, a direct sales company which has an incredible product line of stamps, inks, paper, pocket page style scrapbooking albums and supplies, fabulous embellishments, ribbons, tools and so much more! For anyone not familiar with A Muse Studio, they offer an exclusive line of cling-mount red rubber stamps, custom-printed papers, ribbons, dies and embellishments for creating handmade greeting cards, scrapbook pages and more.

To continue with my love affair with card making, scrapbooking and stamping I joined A Muse Studio three years ago as an Independent Consultant. I offer workshops monthly in my home as well as doing in-home get-togethers (think of a crafty Girls Night Out). I would love to have you 'meetup' at one of my workshops.
results.name: Middlesex County Rubber Stamping & Papercrafting Group

results.description:
This is a group for people who dislike small talk and would rather have intense discussion and debate using evidence-based reasoning. No topics are taboo or off-limits. Come hang out, expand your mind, shock people, and meet like-minded others.

Here are the rules:

• This group strives to be a welcoming environment for anybody who would like to discuss taboo subjects, whether politics, religion, social issues, etc. I have Asperger's Syndrome and want to make this as an inclusive environment as possible for people of all walks of life. We welcome people from all different religious, social, and political backgrounds; people with disabilities, whether they are blind, deaf, need to use a wheelchair etc.; and people who are gay, lesbian, bisexual, pansexual, asexual/demisexual, transgender, genderqueer, agender, bigender, intersex, other queer, questioning, and so forth.

• Obviously, in a group like this, people are bound to be occasionally uncomfortable with some of the topics being discussed.  Please remember that all topics are permitted, provided that those involved in the discussion can provide evidence-based reasoning to back up their viewpoint. If there is a topic that makes you uncomfortable, we will not stop debating it. I would instead encourage you to take a walk and unwind, branch off at another table with other people and discuss something else, or leave and come back next time. 

• Name-calling and ad hominem attacks are unacceptable. Attack people's ideas, not the person themselves. You may say things like, "That idea is fucked up" or "Oh, God, do you believe that?"; these debates tend to get quite impassioned! However, "You're an asshole for suggesting that idea" or "You're an idiot if you believe that" are not okay.

• Have fun!
results.name: Boston/Cambridge/Brookline Intense Discussion and Debate

We're a group of engineers who work with data and data processing systems.

We are especially interested in the aspects of those systems that *aren't* "Data Science"--those difficult and crucial activities like:

- getting, reformatting and cleaning up the data

- designing data processing systems for easy forensics

- operating valuable data processing systems in the real world

If you read that New York Times article "For Big-Data Scientists, 'Janitor Work' Is Key Hurdle to Insights" and thought "Data Janitor and Proud!" then you should join us.

results.description: International Sundays are exclusive access events that take place on a weekly basis. The premise is simple: to deliver a night specifically tailored for a globally sophisticated crowd. Making Sundays at Minibar the premier destination for a wide variety of globally minded individuals, including but not limited to: young professionals, local socialites and fashion enthusiasts. Given the wide variety of backgrounds and nationalities, music genres rotate on a weekly basis. The night has become one of the top attractions for some of Boston's best DJs, the kind of individuals who share the vision and passion of the night's message. Where some Sundays might appear more like Salsa nights, others would be geared towards EDM, Top 40s, open-format or even Mediterranean music. Additionally, we hold fashion shows and other special themed nights (ex. Masquerade parties). International Sundays at Minibar have been going for about two years now, making Sundays one of Boston's longest continuously running nights. Upscale dress code is mandatory and admission is RSVP based. No, there is no cover. If I could cut the longer story short I would simply say that: we've built more than a typical night here, we've built a family. For further information, tables, RSVP please contact : InternationalSundays@Groupmail.com or 857-264-1321
results.name: Boston's International Sundays - Weekly

topics.name: The practical application of Gurdjieff's teachings

results.description: All and Everything, written by GI Gurdjieff, and published in 1949 lays out his ideas regarding the possibility for the further development of ordinary people. But what in me is yet undeveloped, and once developed can it address certain life questions such as personal freedom, and the cessation of unconscious suffering. Our group meets to discuss the teachings of GI Gurdjieff, and Willem Nyland who was asked by Gurdjieff to start groups in America. Through reading of All and Everything, open group discussion, and practical application, we come to understand what inner development might be, and how it would affect the way we live our lives. All who are interested are welcome.  For further information contact www.nyland.org
results.name: Boston/Nyland Gurdjieff Group

results.description: The Boston Real Time Analytics for Big Data group was created to provide a forum for those in Boston to share tips, tricks and knowledge about creating low latency data driven analytical apps to optimize your business.  Data Driven Apps effortlessly bring together your business data with your streaming big data, enabling real-time decisions.  These Apps are fast, focused, quick to deploy, and easily extensible. They are built to address a specific use case and be modified by your analysts as your business requirements change.   What if you could not only discover predictive patterns in your historical data but also identify and act on these events as they occur in real time, while it still matters?  For example: The ability to identify a hack attempt as it occurs so you can act before any damage is done.   With the variety and volume of data available these days from a number of sources (RDBMS, web logs, sensor data, social media, etc.) we're interested in discussing how you make sense of all this data and derive real business value from it in real time.
results.name: Boston Real Time Streaming Analytics for Big Data Meetup

results.description:
Calling all active retirees (or not yet retired but taking time for fun) ready to explore and play with new friends! It's "summer" all year long now for us! We can do what we want, when we want! No more waiting for weekends and then having to try to find parking in crowded lots etc. We are free! I retired from teaching this year and am looking for others who would love to get together for some fun (outdoors preferably) whenever we feel like it! Especially during the week when others are working and places are not crowded. While we will set-up activities to look forward to, those who are up for "last minute" gatherings can share their preferred "instant contact" info and we can text, email or call one another to invite for spontaneous fun.

I love to hike (easy to moderate), bike (same), kayak, scuba when in warm waters and explore new places. I also love to travel and think it would be great to have some friends to travel with. (Right now I'm looking at ways to explore New Zealand and Australia and environs, but I am open to anything.) I'll even learn to play cards again when the nights are long and the weather not so inviting. Don't let my "lack of focus" scare you- it's just about being OPEN to whatever sounds like fun as the moments arise and acting on it- with friends. I'm so happy to be retired! Come and join me ;-)

Regarding bringing friends: Please just have anyone who would like to come along join our group and sign-up for the activity online. Thank-you.


---LEGAL STUFF----

Please note that: AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING  and JOINING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO: Hold harmless, and indemnify the organizers and their relations and heirs, and all members and participants of the Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.  The organizers and event hosts in this group are not trained leaders or instructors. The organizers only set the time and place. Each person participating in any group event is responsible for their own safety. In the interest of safety, consuming alcohol during any Retirees Ready for Adventure active outdoor event is not allowed. Wearing of Lifejackets (PFD's) is required when paddling with this group.

By clicking on "Yes" for any event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows:

In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Metrowest Retirees Ready for Adventure Group for and related to any event which I attend. I attest and verify that I (and any guest(s) I bring are physically fit to participate in any portion of each event I attend.


I grant Metrowest Retirees Ready for Adventure Group permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of all events for any purpose.


Now, let's have fun!
results.name: Metrowest Retirees (or not yet) Ready for Adventure

results.description:
This is a group for introverts who need a bit of nudging, planning or inspiration to close the laptop/book and get out a bit more. Activities will be located around Cambridge/Somerville area, but sometimes venture all the way to Boston. Activities will vary and membership is open to those who consider themselves to be true introverts. There's only one rule: participate. :-)

Please note:  This is not a group to "cure" introverts toward extroversion.   This is a group for introverts to meet others who have the same disposition -- which, I believe I read somewhere,  is about 30% of the population.  Personally,  I like who I am and do not ever wish to be "more extroverted" and I hope you feel the same about yourself.  There are plenty of Meetups for extroverts -- heck, the world favors extroversion.  Help me to carve a nice, quiet, subtle, thoughtful, respectful place for introverts to meet, socialize and celebrate who they are.  :-)

results.description:
Imagine what it would be like to walk through life unafraid, fully comfortable in your own skin, and peaceful - filled with joy at the wonder and flow of life. This is what Tantric Shamanism is all about. It combines the tenants of the deeply ecstatic spiritual aspects of Tantra with the practical personal power-based elements of Shamanism to create a truly luscious experience of life. 

 In this meetup, we'll explore the path into this ecstatic state of being. We'll shift perspectives, learn new ways of being, and step into stronger, fuller, more expansive expressions of ourselves.

Sacred Union - How to Have a Conscious Relationship 
When you come together spiritually and sexually at the same time, you put yourself in a position to find that sacred union that can exist between two people. In these classes, you'll find out how to create better relationships, better connection, and a higher level of intimacy. 

Spiritual Growth 
One of the things that takes us out of relationship quickly is fears, doubts, and insecurities. They are the biggest threat to us getting and keeping love in our lives. In these classes, we'll explore what it takes to really be comfortable in your own skin and how to let go of the fears and neediness that threaten your ability to have healthy relationships. 

Personal Power
In these classes, we'll be discussing how to claim and maintain your personal power. Personal power allows you to speak your truth, set and hold your boundaries, and face and overcome your fears. 

Energy Games 
If you hope to create union with your partner, you'll need to learn how to move your energy and read your partner's energy. In these classes, you'll learn how to work with energy in a fun, hands-on environment. 

And More...
We will be offering a wide variety of classes to serve the needs of those seeking an intimate connection with their partner. All genders/orientations welcome.
results.name: Tantric Shamanism

results.description:
We meet to help one another explore, form, join, or improve businesses without bosses: worker cooperatives.

Join us if you are interested in working for yourself but not working alone— nor in being someone else's boss.

This group is a regular show and tell for freedom-seeking employees, creatives, freelancers, business owners, jobless individuals, and entrepreneurs wanting to learn about and share work experiences applicable to working in a shared-ownership model.  Those of us in worker cooperatives and collectives share our experiences and challenges and discuss ways to make our businesses and our lives better.

Worker cooperatives are businesses owned and controlled by the people who work in them. They are a time-tested way to create quality jobs, and are gaining momentum as a strategy to build and anchor wealth in communities.
results.name: Boston/Cambridge Worker Cooperative Meetup

topics.name: Growing Business thru Fun & Effective Networking

results.description:
Are you looking to grow your business through referrals? Do you enjoy meeting smart, engaging and friendly people with the same goal? 

We are a fun and dedicated group of professionals, entrepreneurs and business owners expanding our businesses by passing referrals to each other. We get to know fellow members — their experience, skills, and talents— then can serve as informal sales teams for each other. Note: allow only one person per profession, so emails us to find out whether there is an "open seat" for you. 

So far this year, we have passed 558 referrals to group members that were worth $1.1 million in business – not bad for a group of 29 people! We are a chapter of Business Networking International, and unlike other networking organizations, BNI allows only one person to represent a given profession so you alone represent your industry, product or service, giving you an edge over your competition. 

We meet from 7-8:30 a.m. in Newton, MA at Cabot Park Village, 280 Newtonville Avenue. The meetings provide lots of opportunities to learn about members' businesses and to network.  And there's a lot of laughter!

Contact us through Meetup and we can tell you whether there is an available seat for your profession/trade. You can also see who is in our group by checking out our website. Hope to meet you soon!

http://www.bnimass.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=4775&t=cc67d5b8a84561cee1166961e91bc074c0751107276f2ad979f997b573979946&name=BNI%20BNI%20Newton%20Connectors
results.name: Newton Connectors: A Business Referral Networking Group

topics.name: Divorce Recovery for men and Women of All Ages

results.description:
Find hope and healing while going through separation or divorce. We learn about relevant topics and discuss them. We support each other during a difficult time in our lives. Friends who have been through separation and divorce are here to help us.

One time registration fee of $20 includes a workbook and snacks.  Scholarships are available.

Topics are presented from a Christian perspective, however all are invited to attend.

All meetings take place at Park Street Church, 1 Park Street, Boston, MA  02108.  Located downtown at the Park Street T stop on the red and green lines.  Parking discounts available after 4pm weekdays and on weekends at One Beacon Street garage ($9. Stamp your ticket at our event) and Boston Common garage ($9.  Buy a voucher from the receptionist at our event).  See www.parkstreet.org/directions for further information.

We are the destination for science and technology people around the I-495 region. This is about 35 towns, including Worcester, Framingham, Littleton, and Franklin.

Holding 4-12 programs every month right at our building in Hopkinton, surely there's something of interest: clean tech? medical instruments? IoT? robotics?  We offer a sense of community and help make connections on both the business side and tech side for those who like to learn while expanding their network.

Industry sectors (medical devices, life sciences, robotics, manufacturing, software, IoT, big data, clean tech and energy, mobile apps, consumer electronics) b

Business topics (funding, marketing) and plain old networking (with a twist as we cover LinkedIn, Social Media, Effective Networking, IP and more).

results.description: The Boston Computational Biology and Bioinformatics (BCBB) Meetup group is a networking event for computational biologists in the Boston / Cambridge area. Thanks to the confluence of top universities, hospitals, research institutes, large pharmaceutical companies, and a vibrant biotech startup community, Boston has arguably the strongest CBB community in the nation. However, for practitioners of computational biology in Boston the landscape can appear siloed and unapproachable, perhaps due in part to the lack of a centralized networking group. The Boston CBB Meetup hopes to fill this void and act as a regular venue for computational biologists in the Boston area to meet, network, share information, and learn.
results.name: Boston Computational Biology and Bioinformatics Meetup

results.description:
This is a "pregnancy club" type group for newly pregnant women who have struggled with depression in the past, are currently feeling well, and want to prevent relapse of depression during pregnancy. It was created for women who are not currently suffering from depression, and who are planning to go off of antidepressant treatment during pregnancy (after careful thought and consultation with their psychiatrist or an expert in perinatal psychiatry).

The aim of the group is to provide extra knowlege, social support, and skills based on techniqes from reseach on resilience and prevention of depression. Our group is collaborative and flexible, social and fun! It's a great way to meet a network of women at a similar stage in pregnancy who are open to discussing the emotional and psychological side of being pregnant. We meet in downtown Boston, near MGH and are planning to begin our next group in December, so if you're interested in being a part of it, get in touch! This would be for women finding out they are pregnant in Oct/Nov/Dec.

No need to actually join this group via meetup.com if you're interested in joining our group (although we welcome you to if you'd like). You can call our office 617-724-2931
results.name: Preventing Depression in Pregnancy Together

results.description:
The combined practice of drawing and movement enhances perception and opens up possibilities for drawing by nourishing the connection between vision and our other senses. We come to experience what we see in the context of what we feel, hear and smell, what we can remember, imagine and depict. Practiced together, movement and drawing neither dilute nor buttress one another but rather run in parallel, demanding both rigor and open-mindedness. 

This drawing and movement group should allow us to practice different movement modalities, such as the Feldenkrais Method of somatic education, the Alexander Technique, Yoga or Pilates, all the while, or alternately, drawing. In pairs or as a group, we can trade off moving and drawing each other move.
results.name: Cambridge Drawing + Movement Meetup

results.description:
I've been where you are. I've tried tons of diets, pills, and potions. I've spent THOUSANDS of dollars on short term solutions to fix a long term problem. I've wondered why I couldn't lose weight when others seem to be able to do so. After numerous failures, I finally succeeded in losing 170 lbs without surgery or pills. Lasting change is possible! You can do it with the right tools and support.

This Meetup will provide you with that support. You have found the place for you if:

- you desire to lose weight now
- have tried more diets than you can count
- are confused by all of the conflicting information available
- are looking for a supportive, nonjudgmental community
- and want to have fun!

Each month (usually the 2nd Thursday of the month at 7PM) I will provide tips on a health related topic followed by an open discussion.

Wanda Cox, Certified Wellness Coach & founder of Wellness With Wanda


http://youtu.be/xuDUl8Vhs9g

Meet Mature like-minded Adults interested in learning more about Soul line dancing i.e. Line Dancing, Shuffles, slides or hustles.  Become a part of Boston's Urban Dance Community with or without a partner. Men Needed, Couples Encouraged and Singles Welcome to the partnering dance styles referred to as "Steppin" previously called  the New Bop referenced from the Hub of Chicago "Chicago-style Steppin--a partnering dance style similar to Swing, Walkin & Detroit Ballroom. This dance style can observed in social settings across US major cities. This is not Greek Steppin.  <br>

This meetup is established to build an interest group, travel club/ class enrollment/ meetup group North & South of Boston, MA while promoting Soul line dancing & Steppin in the Northeast of the USA.

Classes are held locally and around the Northeast.  Demographics 40 plus. Steppin Parties are referred to as SETS and Line Dance Parties speaks for itself. Line dancing events take place in and around MA in these genres: Soul, Progressive-Non Country & Country line dancing in VFW or  mature, safe dance clubs environment. Both dance styles offer an escape, better agility, flexibility, mobility creating a better doctor's report.  Soul line dancing can be Empowering,Inspiring and a whole lot of FUN.  Meet the curious-minded just like you interested in one style or both. Let's Dance Boston!

<br>

Sign Up Today  www.soullinedancers.com <br>

results.description:
Do you hate going to a gym and joining 20 plus people and feel judged during a fitness class but like the camaraderie of a group setting? Do you have physical or health limitations where safe exercise or pose modifications are needed but there isn't anyone to help? Are you looking for a fitness class that will put fun back into fitness? Well look no further.

When you finish a class at Fitness Within, you will leave with a smile on your face and sense of accomplishment.  Our trainers are knowledgeable, friendly, non-judgmental and make sure that you are having fun but have an incredible workout.  At Fitness Within we feel that exercise should be fun and interesting.  The trainers mix up the exercise from class to class so they do not become repetitive and boring.  The goal at Fitness Within is that you look forward to your workout as a time to escape, have fun and focus on yourself.  Our students are of all fitness levels so you will never feel out of place.

Our Kids Bootcamp is a high energy fun filled classes for kids.  Increasing your child's overall health and fitness level by utilizing partner activities, body weight exercises, resistance bands, circuits, fitness games, and more.  This class will create an environment where kids associate fitness with fun which will foster healthy adult living habits for life. 

If you are looking for a personal attention, we specialize in personal and small group training.  In a One-on-One Personal Training session it is you and your trainer.  Your exercise program is designed for your fitness level, goals and nutritional needs.   In a small group setting you will experience the personal attention you want at a budget friendly price.  Small Group Training is limited to 2-8 people and you can join an existing group or start your own with family or friends. 

We offer conditioning and strengthening classes for athletes and gymnasts.  If you are a coach of a youth sports team or a gymnastic studio and would like us to create classes designed for your students, please contact the studio. 

Fitness Within offers members of this meet-up their first class for $5.00.  Thereafter it is a drop in rate of $15.00.  If you have any questions call the studio (781-942-2919), email Domenic (domenic@fitness-within.com) or leave a message on meet-up.

Come by and give it a try!   Domenic, Robin & RoseAnn

Adventures in Photography (New England) is a Meetup Group for the adventurous and travel minded photographer. It provides photographic opportunities beyond the local geographic area with a broad range of interests ranging from grand landscapes to wildlife to exotic cities. Our objective is to take extraordinary images in extraordinary places in the world.

Adventures In Photography Meetup Group would like to share its passion for photography with other like-minded photo enthusiasts. Our Meetup Group will be hosting photography related events such as travel photography and other activities intended to help photographers of all levels come together and enjoy the many rewards that photography has to offer. Photographers of all skill levels who are looking to improve their skills, find new creative outlets for shooting, or just to connect with a friendly group of people to socialize and talk shop are all welcome to join.

While we do intend to offer field trips to the usual destinations that offer a rich variety of photo ops, we have no intention of stopping there. We will seek out unusual and extraordinary destinations that will offer a wide variety of photographic adventures. We intend to offer same day field trips, weekend field trips and longer photo adventures designed to accommodate wide and varied interests.

We are limited only by our imagination and your willingness to support our efforts. Everything connected with this Meetup Group will be conceived, planned and managed by photographers for photographers.

topics.name: Single Parents, Divorced Parents, Widowed Parents
Children of Divorce and Changing Families

results.description:
This  group was formed for the people of the south shore who may often times find themselves going to activities (or would like to) with and/or without their children. If you are in a situation where you have kids and are single, or raising kids  pretty much on your own, you may be familiar with the unique challenges and difficulties sometimes encountered. The hope is that this group will form a fun, helping, sharing, collaborative group of solos, (be it never married, divorced, widowed, or disconnected from the other parent for wk, military, etc)into a community within a community of people that would like to have a social life for both them and their children.  We can plan events, meetups and play dates with or without our kids. These meetups can be a huge spectrum of ideas...from parents meeting at a local place to us planning a big moms or dads night out in the city. There are all sorts of possibilities depending on our members. My hope is simply new friends will be made for social contact that is family friendly, or just for the mums and dads that want to connect and have fun with others in common situations.  <br> Anyone is welcome! It is not a prerequisite to be single, nor is it necessary to even have kids, if you're interested in just the adult time!?
In the future we may get to a level where we could assist each other with a huge number of things.  Ie. babysitting, car pooling..there are endless possibilities based on interests of the group! Some trips, activities, excursions, etc, are hard with little ones if you're solo-but with extra hands maybe it's more doable!? Sometimes more enjoyable for parent and kid alike. .....but, as they say, it takes a " village" so initial kiddo ideas are endless and based on the ages of the members kids..

So please join us, get Yourself a sitter, bring photo or two of the kiddos ( if you've got kids) and let's see where it goes....If you're looking to join and you don't have kids, you can get a feel for the crowd. Many people that are looking for fun stuff to do around the south shore may have kids, but they're off to college, etc, and can enjoy the adult time with other singles..... And you can enjoy kiddo activities and play dates on weeks with kids, as we plan them. 

I envision a supportive laid back group of solos that enjoy staying active, getting out here and there, being social and want to further their kids socially...As parents with our kids, plus an extra set of eyes n hands. Or just hang out and meet new people.....form connections with people who may be on a similar path at this point in their life ( or have been there) and just get out when we can.��
results.name: The VILLAGE people of the south shore-help,share,care&FUN!

results.description:
Welcome to the Working Mom’s Playgroup (Franklin Area!)

We are a Chapter of the Working Mom’s Playgroup, Inc. which is a nonprofit corporation and a 501(c)3 publicly-supported charity registered with the IRS.

Geographic Region
The Working Mom’s Playgroup (Franklin Area), is geared towards mothers residing in the towns of Franklin, Bellingham, Mendon, Medway, Millis, Norfolk and Wrentham. We believe it is important for all mothers to foster relationships with fellow moms residing within their close community. Mothers who live outside this catchment area will be encouraged to work with the main corporation, Working Mom’s Playgroup, Inc., to develop a chapter in her local area. Women who are not mothers, as well as those living outside of the listed communities who wish to join, are subject to the approval from the Chapter Officers. 

Annual Dues
Membership Fees are $25.00, to be paid within 1 month of joining and renew annually.

Types of activities 
The types of activities that will be found on our calendar will increase over time but can be anticipated to include:

Connections: 
We provide opportunities for moms, children and families to meet and develop relationships. These activities are the ‘core’ of the WMPlaygroup. 
Examples: Age-Based Playgroups, New Member Only events, Coffee Chat, Family events, Summer Play Dates and additional age-based play dates, Mom’s Night In (MNI), Mom’s Night Out (MNO), etc.

Enrichment: 
We provide opportunities to which enrich the lives of mothers, families and children within our group as well as in the larger community. 
Examples: Book Chat, Stony Hill Discovery Program, Discussion Groups, etc.

Health and Fitness: 
We provide opportunities for members to engage in group activities based upon living a healthy lifestyle. 
Examples: Weight Loss Support, Evening walks/hikes, charity and team walks/runs, group fitness classes, etc.

Community Outreach: 
We provide opportunities for moms to support charitable, humanitarian and social welfare projects related to mothers, families and children and to teach children to think about the needs of others. 
Examples: Schools on Wheels, Gifts for Kids, Collection Drives (diapers, coats, Halloween Costumes, Non-Perishable Foods, etc.)

Events: 
We would like to begin organizing special and annual events. 
Examples could include: Family Halloween Costume Party, Vendor Event, Mom’s Only Holiday Party, Summer Family Picnic, Mani/Pedi Night, Mom’s Weekend Away, etc.

Communications
The Working Mom’s Playgroup  utilizes Meetup.com and personal email to communicate with Members as well as for Members to communicate with each other.

Get Involved
Because this is a "meetup" group, participation is expected. By joining our group you are making a commitment to yourself, your children, and our members to attend events.There are many ways to get involved: whether it’s attending events that have been posted to the calendar, participating in social media discussions or joining the leadership team. You will find many opportunities for the WMPlaygroup to enrich your life.
results.name: The Working Mom's Playgroup                  (Franklin Area)

results.description:
Agile Testing Alliance (ATA) is a non-profit Agile testing community and certification organization. It is a global alliance of visionary industry leaders, prominent authors, leading educational institutions and testing evangelists who are passionate about proliferation of agile in testing. ATA’s mission is to grow agile testing awareness, practices, acceptance and to create a learning roadmap specifically in agile testing space. ATA helps agile practitioner to identify the milestones that can be evaluated, certified and recognized.

ATA provides platform for local communities to get together & share ideas on agile testing/automation through local chapters across multiple countries & cities. Greater Boston meet-up group is created for professionals in and around Boston area. We invite all Agile practitioner to come forward and spread awareness about Agile testing in their local areas through hosting events. 

We plan to host seminars/workshops on Agile Testing & Agile automation with you and for you. 

So let's do it.!!!
results.name: Agile Testing Alliance - Greater Boston Chapter

results.description:
Sleep ASAP is a sleep management education organization, striving to achieve two main goals: raising awareness to the scope and severity of sleep deprivation in all its varied forms, and making the widest possible range of (non-drug based) methods for sleep management accessible to sleep strugglers worldwide to support informed decision making and empower people to choose the most suitable methods for them.

There are multiple alternative and valuable solutions which exist and which can solve the frustrating problem of falling asleep.

we will be hosting local events as well as connecting the members to global events which will take place online. 

Our primary focuses are on;

Providing studies regarding sleeping disorder

Experts from various fields will share insightful perspectives and inputs from neurology, psychology, musicology, art therapy and more!

Global case studies and best practices will be shared

Our requirements from the group members are;

This group is meant to provide honest and open information. The exchange of personal information is only within this group

SLEEP ASAP is a NEW global community. It is intended to promote understanding, awareness and provide tools to help cope with these day to day problems.

Using any foul language or soliciting any provocative action shall ban the member from the group and can also lead to legal action to be taken by us against the offender.

Members that either are not affected by sleeping disorders OR that have personal intentions that do not deal with sleep disorders/insomnia, are kindly requested not to join nor participate

Our expectations

We wish to increase the Sleep ASAP global community. 10-15% of people suffer from chronic sleeping disorders and about 50% from temporary sleeping disorders. Like other mental barriers, the consequences of not tackling this issue affects the personal day to day business but also the general quality of life.

We expect group members to engage in group activities, to look in the information we will provide and make use of the valuable tools given here.

Sleep ASAP mega event

Aside from local meetups, SLEEP ASAP - Alternative Solutions will hold a global event which will take place in a few months. This will be a marathon of 24 hours that will focus on the aforementioned topics.


This group was created for those people that are struggling to fall asleep. Expanding the knowledge about creative and unexpected tools can provide a better quality of life.

Join us!
results.name: Sleep ASAP - Boston

results.description:
The Southeastern Hiking Club is open to all adults.  We are a laid back, diverse and social group who enjoy exploring nature with others on a variety of different trails throughout Blue Hills and beyond.


When:

We hike year round, at least once every weekend on Saturday or Sunday at 1:00PM. There are a few sunset hikes planned throughout the year as well.  


Where:

Most hikes are located within the Blue Hills area. Occasionally,  the club meets at other locations such as; Borderlands,  Moose Hill, Gilbert State Park,  Wilson & Whitcomb Woods,  Ellisville Harbor State Park,  Massasoit State Park, Freetown State Forest and Wompatuck State Park.........


Quorum: 

There is not a minimum  (or maximum) number of people required for a  hike to take off for DCR hikes. Typical hikes have anywhere from 15 - 35 people during summer/fall months, less during the winter months.   


Terrain, Distance and Pace:

The terrain can vary for each hike. The terrain levels below will be listed for each hike.

- Easy - (Mostly level terrain)

- Moderate - (Hilly terrain)

- Difficult - (Strenuous & steep)

The distance for each hike is typically between 2-5 miles.


Facilities:

There are well maintained restrooms at the majority of hike locations. We will try to make a note when this is not the case within each meetup notification.


Fees:

There is no fee to join the Southeastern Hiking Club.  

The majority of state parks & forests do not charge a parking fee, however there are a couple charge a  $2/$5 parking fee. We will try to make a note of which ones on the meetup notification. 


Hike Types:

Scheduled weekend DCR hikes are led by a Park Ranger or designated volunteer.  Club members also get together for non sanctioned DCR hikes which are referred to as "SHC" within the title of meetup notifications.


Club Member Participation:

Some members hike every weekend while others only hike during certain seasons, locations or levels of difficulty. With that said, there is no set expectation for participation from club members.  Hike as often as you like.  


Park Ranger Recommendations/Requirements:

- Wear hiking boots, or sturdy footwear. 

- Bring and carry water on all hikes.

- Dress appropriately for the weather.


Disclaimer: 

During all events, everyone is responsible for themselves. The meet up organizer and assistant organizers are not responsible for the safety of participants. By joining the group, you acknowledge this. <br>
results.name: Southeastern Hiking Club

results.description: ACM Boston is a non-profit professional group that meets regularly to discuss diverse topics in computer science such as predictive analytics, applied machine learning, statistical modeling, open data, and data visualization, user experience, user research, and artificial neural networks. Meeting topics are varied and range from tutorials on basic concepts and their applications, to success stories from local practitioners and academic students, to discussions of tools, new technologies, and best practices. All are welcome to attend, to meet others, and to present their work. ACM Boston is officially a part of the ACM Local program of Association for Computing Machinery, Inc.
results.name: ACM Boston

results.description:
We see this as a working group to help bring about change in Somerville. This grouphopes to help create a future where tiny houses exist legally within the city limits of this vibrant, forward-thinking and diverse city. 


The Mission Statement on the SomerVision website states their intentions:
Celebrate the diversity of our people, cultures, housing and economy.
Foster the unique character of our residents, neighborhoods, hills and squares, and the strength of our
community spirit as expressed in our history, our cultural and social life, and our deep sense of civic
engagement.
Invest in the growth of a resilient economic base that is centered around transit, generates a wide
variety of job opportunities, creates an active daytime population, supports independent local businesses,
and secures fiscal self-sufficiency.
Promote a dynamic urban streetscape that embraces public transportation, reduces dependence on the
automobile, and is accessible, inviting and safe for all pedestrians, bicyclists and transit riders.
Build a sustainable future through strong environmental leadership, balanced transportation modes,
engaging recreational and community spaces, exceptional schools and educational opportunities,
improved community health, varied and affordable housing options, and effective stewardship of our
natural resources.
Commit to continued innovation and affirm our responsibility to current and future generations in all of
our endeavors: business, technology, education, arts and government.

Sounds good to me! GOOOO SOMERVILLE!!!  - Dana
results.name: Somerville Tiny House Meetup

results.description: We've grown a large following in Texas and now want Boston and the surrounding area to share in on the fun! Boston Sophisticated Singles's mission is to provide a dynamic, innovative, and engaging environment for singles around the ages of 25-55. Some of our events include: "Speed Mingling", "Mystery Cards", "Mega Matchmaking Mixer", industry appreciation nights, wine mixers, bowling, seminars, and much more. This group sets itself apart by its partnership with Scenergy Dating which provides online dating, matchmaking, and additional events for singles. Best of all, we not only believe in connecting singles but also improving their dating skills through our seminars. All ages, professions, and backgrounds are invited so come on out and remember there are no expectations we simply want you to join the scene!

results.description: Microservices Architecture is the specific way of dividing software applications and infrastructure into small services. Each service is built, tested, and operated by a small team. This method is adopted by some of the leading technology companies like Google, Amazon and Netflix. This methodology is still evolving and there is still no consensus on best practices or situations where this approach is recommended over other. The aim of this group is to share latest information and discuss merits and challenges associated with this approach.
results.name: Massachusetts Microservices Meetup

results.description:
Boston Colors is a meet up group for LGBTQ Community for all walks of life  in and around the Boston Area.   This group was created for people of every color to come together and have a good time as a family.  What’s Life without a little Color! 

Here are some of the meet ups this group has in store!! Sunday Funday Brunches, BBQ’s, dinner, concerts, drinks, museums, art festivals, road trips, karaoke, bowling, paint parties, exercise/dance classes, weekend getaways, comedy shows, wine tastings, discussions, wellness activities, pot lucks, dancing, volunteering, the possibilities really are endless!  If this sounds like fun to you an you look to be part of a great active group please join and share your colors with us!

Please update your RSVP to all meet ups. It’s okay to change your mind at any point. Things can come up, but once you know you can’t make it or that you can, just take a moment to update your RSVP, or note it in the comments.  It’s nice to have an accurate attendee count.

results.description:
Shorinji Kempo is a Japanese martial art practiced around the world, and designed to help practitioners realize their potential through the study of effective self-defense techniques. Regular practice involves cooperatively training with others and incorporates both hard (punches, kicks, blocks) and soft techniques(escapes, locks, throws). To complement this are seated meditation and explorations of the underpinning philosophy. Practitioners work together to become confident, well-intentioned individuals who can lead and inspire others.

The Boston Branch is affiliated with the US Shorinji Kempo Federation and the World Shorinji Kempo Organization (WSKO) in Tadotsu, Japan.
results.name: Shorinji Kempo Meetup

results.description: This is a group for people passionate about healthy living whether it means exercising, eating healthy, staying active or just making smarter decisions about your health. This group was started for a like-minded people who made a choice to stay healthy. The goal is to meet new people through fun events, stay active and learn from each other. We can have discussions about nutrition, fitness, cooking, health or anything else. We can go rock climbing, go out for a healthy dinner or just meet over coffee and talk about different things. No age restriction. Open to any suggestions.

Please bear with me as I am still in the process of defining this group. I formulated this group to create a space north of the city where we can have civil discourse about subjects related to Social Justice and Environmental Issues. I would like to start with a book reading meetup. I am in the process of reading "The New Jim Crowe" by Michelle Alexander. I would like to meet with others also reading this book to discuss.

I hope this group will push us all to look a little deeper into issues that concern us. Let's do our homework to learn what is going on in our society and then share our discoveries. My goal is to arm myself with facts so that I may better articulate my point of view.

Much more info here!

results.description:
This is a group for people who want to be a part of a startup led by a technical founder. The problem with many startup cofounder events is that there are too many non-technical people looking for technical people to implement their ideas.  

The most qualified person to found a tech, web or mobile app startup is the person who can write the code. 

You may join this group if:

A) You are a technical founder with your own ideas.

B) You are technical and want to join a technical team.

C) If you are not technical, You want to help a technical founder with skill such as marketing and sales, general support, financing and business administration.

As a start, you may enjoy this excellent article from the founder of Ycombinator about his first startup, which was borne in Cambridge. http://www.paulgraham.com/avg.html

results.description:
**Always check for updates via this page. It is always up-to-date.**

Hello Folks,

I created this group for people who want to play a friendly-and-competitive game of touch or flag football on the weekends. Open to all levels- beginners, intermediates, and skilled players. Open to all genders.

Games will be scheduled on either Saturday or Sunday around noon time. We will probably be playing 1 game a week. Not required to play every single game, just the ones you want to play.

Games will be set up 1-3 weeks(s) in advance for people who work and need to request time off. Address of field will be given when a game is set up. We will play mostly in Quincy but probably not at the same field each week due to other peoples' events. Let's all have fun, meet new people, and enjoy a game of football.

Members are more than welcomed to invite guests, but please inform me and the group first so we can set up games correctly. Thank you.


Next Spring (2016) we will be including baseball in our schedule.

results.name: New and Expecting Moms of Maynard (and surrounding towns)

results.description:
Greetings!
Welcome to the photography meetup group for expats and world travelers. 

Whether you have always called Boston home, or are just learning your way around, this photography group is a great way to discover the beauty of Boston. We are serious about having fun together. We will learn about Boston while honing our photography skills. And after class we always make time for socializing with food and drinks in the neighborhood we are exploring together.

If you've ever wanted to learn how to take better photos, but you don't want to get bogged down with all the technical stuff, then you're going to love this. 

This meetup group is for you if:

• You own a camera (or smart phone with a camera) and you'd really like to use it more, but you're not really sure where to start and what to do.

• You would like to explore different neighborhoods in Boston like Chinatown, The North End, and Beacon Hill.

• You enjoy meeting likeminded people from different cultures who love photography.

• Maybe you've taken a photography workshop before or tried picking up one of those thick, boring books, but you quickly got overwhelmed and overloaded with the technical stuff.

• You don't intend on becoming a "master photographer", but you'd like to learn how to take better pictures of things you find interesting. That could be nature, people, landscape, architecture, etc. Whatever you feel drawn to.

And the best part? The techniques you'll learn will have an immediate impact on your photography. You'll see an instant improvement and you'll also have an opportunity to get positive and constructive feedback for your work in a supportive environment.

If that sounds good to you, then I invite you to join our group. You'll learn a lot, meet some warm and wonderful people, and have lots of fun while you improve your photography, your English, and your knowledge of Boston. I'm looking forward to meeting you in person soon.

You can get started learning some of the practices by exploring my award winning book.

Flow-tography Take Better Pictures.

http://itunes.apple.com/us/book/flow-tography-better-phot...
results.name: Boston Expats: Take Better Pictures Fun Photo Workshops

Brand new for 2015! Do you hate 99.9% of what you hear on the radio? Or perhaps you don't even listen to music on the radio, because it sucks so bad. Well you just might be a music snob. This doesn't mean you're a snobby or rude person in general – you're just particular about your music.

results.description:
Hi everybody,
welcome to the ski&ride group of Boston Metro area. We primarily go to Wachusett, that is because is close, very easy accessible by both car and train, (some like me have to work the day before).

Wachusett Resort is the most accessible in New England.

How to get there 
Car(if you don't have GPS): 
http://www.wachusett....


Public transportation: the train to Fitchburg ($10ea) will leave from North Station at 8:30am where a Wachusett Shuttle will be there waiting to take skiers and riders to the resort, way back is at 4:30pm to get on the train at 5:30pm. This is great for whoever doesn't want to drive and park (now you take the shuttle from the parking lot).



Tickets: 
$65 8am-6pm (adult All Areas)
$53 (Monadnock Quad & Carpet Lifts Only)
$15 (Carpets)




Meet: the easiest is to meet in fr
ont of the main entrance of the resort . 

Drinks: Let's meet at the Coppertop Lounge for drinks at 4pm, there is also some sport updates with tv screens. 



Hope to see many of you soon!

Ari
results.name: Boston Metro Snowboarding and Skiing @Wachusett

results.description:
Mmmmaven (simply pronounced "Maven") is a passionate community of music lovers that encourages musicians, enthusiasts and kids of all ages to explore the power of combining music and technology. Established in 2011, we've thrown hundreds of events and graduated hundreds of students in the art of mixing and making music using the power of a computer.

This Meet-Up will serve as an easy to way stay on top of all variety of events: From pop-up vinyl shops to area demos at schools and museums. Of course, we have a good amount of free lessons and workshops in the laboratory as well, mostly on Fridays after work.

The bottom line is, if you're at all interested in the intersection of music and technology, you're a Mmmmaniac! You'll find a welcoming community of like-minded creatives, musicians, developers and DJs at our different types of events. 

For a short video on how the school works, watch this animated video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pMCkW9mA3nU
results.name: Mmmmaven

results.description: This group is for anyone interested in infrared photography. IR photography is making a huge resurgence now that most digital cameras can be converted to see in the IR spectrum. Many photographers are converting their older model cameras or buying buying new gear to have it converted. This group is designed to cover all aspects of IR photography. We will start by talking about conversion types and IR basics. We will also be doing critiques, round table discussions, infrared workflow and photoshop workshops as well as on location meetups to photograph landscapes and models. Whether you're a newbie or an experienced photographer if you're interested in learning more about this artistic medium come join us!
results.name: Boston Infrared Photography Meetup

results.description:
We are looking to bring together like-minded couples in the 495 corridor (Milford, Bellingham, Franklin, etc.) for social and outdoor activities. If you’re some combination of the following, you’ll probably like our group:

•You enjoy traveling

•You enjoy going out for drinks and/or nice dinners

•You like to stay active

•You’ve traveled, lived, or worked outside of the US

•You like new activities and experiences

We have young children, but are happy to welcome diverse members to the group. We’ll be starting out with activities for couples, but might mix in family activities depending on the types of members we attract. Activities will include happy hours, restaurant nights (dining out or in), card nights, other game nights, and outdoor-based activities. We look forward to bringing some fun to the lives of people who decide to join in.

results.description:
Cambridge Community Round Table brings Cambridge, MA residents, neighborhood associations and businesses together from all parts of Cambridge to discuss topics of interest to the community. This is a critical time to be involved, because the City is developing a Master Development Plan, which will change the design and vision for the city. Civic Engagement is critical to the function of democracy. The citizens and businesses of Cambridge have the power to influence the decisions made by the City, if they participate in the process. With greater participation from the people, the City can make better decisions that more accurately reflect the best interests of everyone, not just a small group. Greater participation will also help to achieve greater transparency of City activities, and a more open government.

Join us for free, casual and engaging discussions on how the City of Cambridge is doing a great job, and where there is room for improvement!

These events are organized by City Council Candidates Kim Courtney and Xavier Dietrich, who feel that there are not enough venues and opportunities for the community to be heard.
results.name: Cambridge Community Round Table

results.description: This is a group for women over 50 who live in the city of Boston.  We will meet to socialize and enjoy getting together for lunch, coffee, wine, walking, museum and other outings. There has been a surge in people moving back to the city later in life. Hoping to bring together women in downtown Boston, newly moved from the suburbs or other areas, empty nesters, retired, those available to enjoy the city during the week. We can shape the activities to our wishes. A variety of small group activities can lead to more ideas and events. Activities will be focused in the heart of the city, available by the T.  Please note that this group is for day time activities on weekdays.
results.name: Boston Women over 50, Weekday Gatherings

results.description: Our group meets every Thursday at 7 pm in a beautiful old stone barn for a guided meditation followed by discussion and ,if time allows we sometimes end with a second meditation. We are like geese flying together,each one of us"drafts''off of the others, we support each other and share the journey . As this is held in a traditional yoga school we also "move into meditation" on Tuesdays at 5:30. Meditation is freely offered, a $5 donation is requested to help pay rent and heat . The "mindful movement" on Tuesdays is one of the yoga classes and the studio offers unlimited classes ,7 days a week, for only $30 for the first 30 days !
results.name: Meditation group at Breathewellness, Cook Lane,  Marlborough

results.description:
The Boston Chapter of FWD.us is your home for Tech and Politics. It's a place to meet like-minded people, build networks and leadership skills, discuss issues you care about, and take action.

Our FWDMonthly meetups explore different topics at the intersection of tech and politics. Guest speakers share their expertise on the month’s issue. Afterwards, members break into teams to tackle specific challenges. From devising innovative ways to connect constituents to Congress to amplifying compelling local narratives, your efforts help fuel the movement for reform.

FWD.us is a nonprofit advocacy group founded by Mark Zuckerberg and other key leaders in the tech community. Our mission is to mobilize the tech community to advocate for legislation that will keep the American Dream achievable in the 21st Century. Our current priority is Immigration Reform.
results.name: FWD.us Boston Chapter

results.description:
Starting a restaurant/bakery/cafe is tough business. If you are planning to open a food establishment or you are already running one, this group is for you. 

We have first hand experience in a great variety of aspects and we hope to contribute to each other's success by sharing information and resources. We also have investors among us who are always looking for smart business ideas. Some of the topics that we plan to cover are as follows: Real estate, shop design, construction, branding, menu development, staffing, operations, sourcing and suppliers, kitchen equipment, pricing, marketing promotions, partnerships, legal matters, accounting and finance, business expansions, franchising.

We are all lovers of good food and it motivates us to get to know more people like us.
results.name: Restaurant Entrepreneurs Community

results.description: Join us if you are interested in reading a wide variety of literature that includes contemporary fiction, classics, biography, historical fiction, and non-fiction. Each month, the members present at the meeting will recommend the books for the following month, voting will be done on the spot - alternating genres. Books in second and third place may be forwarded to the next month for voting.  This is an open book group and we welcome men and women, young and young-in-spirit.
results.name: Voracious Readers Confabulate in Natick

Polyvore members are hosting meetups all over the world. Come meet your Polyvore friends! This is where you will find information on Polyvore meetups in Boston.
results.name: Polyvore Boston Meetup

results.description: The South Shore Roundtable Group for Controllers is a group of peers working together to gain valuable leadership skills, while enhancing professional and personal development in the management accounting area. We welcome accountants, controllers, CFO's, accounting and finance professionals, and business owners who are interested in financial management of their business. We will seek to explore topics that we can all relate to or need some guidance in. Topics could include steps to build a strong accounting department, sales and use tax compliance, internal audits, software, when to or when not to outsource, risk management, delivering financial reports to non-financial readers, strategic planning, communication skills, what is the difference between a leader and a manager and many more topics as we dive in. We want a roundtable environment to connect with peers without having to travel to Boston or further. We want an open communication environment where participation is encouraged.
results.name: Controller and Management Accounting Roundtable Group

results.description:
Data Science is a broad, fast-moving field; peer-to-peer learning is critical to a successful data science career! Unlike other data science Meetup groups that focus on presenting data science content, this group focuses on optimizing your professional development. Members of this Meetup group will get and give personalized career advice, learn content and receive content recommendations from peers, and intelligently grow their professional network. The most successful practitioners have many mentors and even more mentees. Join us - your career depends on it!

When you join our group - please take the data scientist survey to fully participate!
results.name: Data Science Professional Development Boston

topics.name: Support for Parents of Special Needs Kids

results.description: This group welcomes parents of special needs children ranging from mild learning disabilities to more significant special needs. This is a "no judgement" group that meets to mingle and meet other parents who are traveling the same special needs path.  Most Meetups will be "a meet & and greet" for coffee or cocktails and chatting with other parents in a restaurant setting.  Don't miss the interactive workshops with topics that will help parents navigate their special education path with confidence and knowledge.  Some workshop topics include IEP Review, Understanding Evaluations, Negotiation skills for Team Meetings, Effective Team Communication, Effective Progress versus Lack of Progress, Educational Lingo, with many more events to come as we evolve as a group.  Q & A is always a popular way to end the evening!  So join us to socialize, make connections and learn how to effectively advocate and educate your special needs child. Lets build ourselves a community because it takes a village to raise a child!
results.name: Special Education Meetup

results.description: Put an end to boring weekends! Awesome Weekend is here to help people of all ages have the best weekends imaginable. results.description: "Information Explosion" has been defined as the rapid increase in the amount of published information/data and the effects of this abundance. The New England Search Technologies Group (NEST) was formed with the goal of making this ever expanding information content and data "findable" using technology components like Apache Lucene/Solr and ElasticSearch coupled with some "best practices" for modeling and transforming your data for optimal relevancy and recall. We will explore topics such as search engines, content extraction, data modeling, text analysis, natural language processing, entity recognition, analytics and recommendation systems. Let's learn, share and solve business search problems!
results.name: New England Search Technologies (NEST) Group

results.description:
We're so happy you found us. You and the kids are going to LOVE our weekly adventures!

Our group meets YEAR-ROUND every Tuesday at 10am at various hiking trails in the metrowest area. It's a great opportunity to meet up with friends and enjoy some relaxing outside time and learn some new trails mostly likely right in your back yard! These events are FREE and appropriate for children up to 6 years.

Previously, I was a part of a great hiking group closer to Boston that met every week. Even though I have moved to the 'burbs', I still get out there every week with my family and would love to meet other parents who know the value of getting our kiddos outdoors.

The hikes are suited for caregivers who carry their children and for young children who toddle/run on their own. No stroller hikes unless specified in the details of the hike. Please dress appropriately for the weather and terrain with layers, appropriate footwear, hats, sunscreen and water. Be prepared for ice, mud, scorching heat and/or brisk winds! This is New England after all; though I don't expect them all in one hike. 

We stroll at a slower pace to allow the children to soak up the environment, caregivers can chat with a new friend and we'll try to keep the group relatively close together. Our trail will be short and simple so you are free to take another loop around. Also, if your little one's pace is REALLY slow (I was once in that group) you can linger on the first trail in and we'll meet up with you on the way out.

Remember, we're kid friendly. We're all parents and caregivers doing our best to enjoy the outdoors with young children. The trails are selected for ease of walking and are short enough for the young ones to endure.  We'll take breaks and spend plenty of time playing in leaves or snow, rolling over logs to check for bugs and skipping stones..... all things our kids should be doing and this is great place for it.

Please feel free to contact me with any questions. I'm happy to help!

See you out on the trail!

Emily Z
results.name: Kid Friendly MetroWest Hikes

results.description: We will become the largest social, support and active gathering of Type 1 Diabetics in Boston in 2015. Be ready to learn, improve your health and smile.

results.description:
The Decentralized Autonomous Society opens shop in Boston with monthly meetings discussing how new types of technology (i.e. smart contracts and decentralized autonomous organizations) can facilitate a greater degree of human freedom and autonomy. 

In the early 90s the cypherpunk movement held its meetup in Palo Alto, working through many ways in which cryptographic technology could be used to promote human freedom. Eventually Bitcoin was born. 

Today we discuss how the second wave of blockchain innovation can enhance human freedom.

With presentations from:

Joel Dietz, SWARM / co-founder DAS on "The Philosophy of Autonomy and Decentralized Technology" 
John Robb, author Brave New War, on "The Road to Turkdom"

results.description:
"Pagans & Witches in Greater Boston" is an open community intended to create public events for Pagans, Wiccans, Witches, Goddess Worshippers, Heathen, Polytheists and other like minded magical folk to gather and experience a welcoming and affirming community in the Greater Boston area.

We are a growing group of individuals from various paths coming together to celebrate, network, and work towards filling some of the greater needs of the Boston magical community.  It is our hope that this group can to be a be a focal point for fostering a greater spirit of community under the Boston Pagan umbrella. We offer a sacred and safe space to gather, meet others, communicate your ideas and join in public ritual and social time.

We do not adhere or promote any specific religious tradition. "Pagans & Witches in Greater Boston" itself, is not a coven or closed magical circle.  All who feel called to Pagan spirituality are welcome to attend, as long as they can be respectful of the space and each other.  Please be advised that all those who do participate in our open events and extended community are agreeing to adhere to our Anti-Harassment Policy (please read the full policy listed under "Files" on this meet-up page); actions, behaviors and intention contradictory to that policy will be strictly prohibited.

We do have opportunities for those wishing to take an active role in community event planning; please feel free to contact group organizers online or in person to discuss these opportunities further.


Blessings Always!
results.name: Pagans & Witches in Greater Boston
