results.description:
Are you ready to bust through the blocks and limiting beliefs that may be tripping you up in life? Are you ready to stop listening to your Fear Voice? Are you ready to work miracles? This group is for people who are ready and willing to make simple, consistent shifts in their thinking and actions in order to improve all aspects of their daily lives, including relationships, finances, bodies, and self-image.

My name is Michele and I am the Organizer of the North of Boston May Cause Miracles Meetup group. I am a Licensed Independent Clinical Social Worker, a Life Fulfillment Coach and I have been mentored and trained by Gabrielle Bernstein to be a May Cause Miracles Practitioner!

The May Cause Miracles Workshops are based on Gabrielle Bernstein's New York Times best-selling book. Throughout the 6 week program, you will learn how to create beautiful, radical change in all areas of your life by adding up subtle shifts every day and week. Though each shift is simple, consistently choosing LOVE over FEAR will transform your life in ways you may never have thought possible. Workshop members can expect incredible transformation through the 40 day/6 week program and ultimately, a life filled with abundance, acceptance, appreciation, and happiness.

The workshop is offered as a 6 week program where members meet weekly for 6 consecutive weeks and each week focuses on a different chapter OR as a 2 day weekend program where each day focuses on 3 chapters from the book.

$250 includes:

Workshop (either once a week for 6 weeks or a 2 day weekend)

Your own copy of "May Cause Miracles"

Access to a private Facebook group for members to connect, support eachother and share struggles and accomplishments.

Unlimited email support throughout program.

20% discount on individual coaching packages with Michele

Please email Michele with questions michele@blisslifecoaching.net
results.name: North of Boston "May Cause Miracles" Workshops

results.description:
This meetup is for any single man or woman over 40 who would like to benefit from discovering the latest information about, and receiving friendly peer support for, navigating dating in today's social landscape. 

We will meet once a week for 10 weeks for targeted workshops, with additional fun outings to practice what we are learning and to have fun! The workshops will include guest speakers, multimedia presentations, homework assignments which help you practice what you are learning, paneled discussions, and more. 

Have you ever wanted to ask the opposite sex a dating question in a safe environment, and know you're going to hear the truth about what they think? Have you ever hoped to be able to sit down with a group of peers and be able to ask your own gender what their dating issues, fears, and expectations are? Would you benefit from open, frank conversations with men and women your own age, about tips and methods of finding the mate you are seeking? Stop struggling in the dating scene and start enjoying it, from a wise, confident, intentional, approach that helps you recognize what you are really seeking, and how to take more beneficial actions towards your goal, and to spend less dead-end time and energy on efforts that lead you away from your goal.
results.name: Merrimack Valley 40+ Dating Workshop & Fun!

results.description: This group will be following the format of Speaking Circles as developed by Lee Glickstein. A Speaking Circle is designed to give people the confidence and the skills to interact with others, to speak in informal situations, and to present in front of small groups. Examples of people that are drawn to Speaking Circles include: • People that get nervous when making a presentation or speaking at a meeting. • People that find it hard to make conversation at gatherings and social events. • People who lock up or feel awkward in social situations. • Anybody who wants to improve their speaking skills in informal situations. Imagine standing in front of any audience, feeling absolutely confident and at ease. That is what Speaking Circles can do for you. Whether you have public speaking anxiety or simply want to express yourself with greater clarity the experience in a Speaking Circle® will guide you toward effortless authenticity. Speaking Circles help: Business professionals become more effective, authentic and powerful. People expand their vision of what life could be like when they are able to be fully present, confident and authentic. People who suffer from stage fright to overcome their fears. At a Speaking Circle you are provided all the support you need to express yourself in your own time and in your own unique way, without fear or discomfort. Some call this depth of expression, “speaking from the heart,” “the authentic self” or “your real voice.” Whatever you call it, you know when you are there; you know when someone else is there. Use this link to read FAQs about a Speaking Circle. http://www.speakingcirclesinternational.com/Articles/Prin... See and hear participants talk about their experience in SPEAKING CIRCLES: http://youtu.be/Wi82ZIgioh0
results.name: SPEAKING FROM PRESENCE

results.description:
The group will focus on young people who want more out of life then to sit in a cubicle watching the days pass them by.  We want to begin a movement in order to help to ignite all young people to own their lives physically and financially an, through our contributions, create Freedom and a lasting legacy.  We want young, open-minded people to come network and brainstorm about how we can break out of the mold of college, job, loans, working 86,000 hours, retirement...  How can we help each other to dream about and create the life we truly want?

We want all young entrepreneurs looking for a group to help give them the ability, courage and freedom to dream big and think outside the limitations of ‘normal’ life, the space to realize they can design and create the life they want, and the skills, confidence, framework and support to make it happen.

We'll meet a couple of times a month to throw around ideas and help eachother gain the knowledge and experience of thinking outside the box.  The meetings will vary from happy hour networking to business-type presentations. We encourage all members to present ideas to the group!

This group is not only for those oddball INFJs, but any intuitive type in need of meaningful conversation with good people. As Cornel West said in one of his rambling videos, “I'm a bluesman in the life of the mind, I'm a jazzman in the world of ideas. It's true that you might be socially isolated, but you're intensely alive." If this resonates with you and you’re willing to forgo social isolation, join us!


***Our social group is geared toward young adults in their 20s and 30s. ***

results.description:
Everyone knows a "Nice Guy." He's the great listener whose female friends call him a catch, but doesn't have a date on Saturday night. He's the husband who tries to please his wife, but whose marriage is tanking. He's the reliable buddy who everyone turns to for favors, but his own life's in a shambles.

No More Mr Nice Guy is a book and plan of action for men written by Dr. Robert Glover, a long-time psychotherapist holding a PhD in marriage and family therapy. The book is all about enabling men to achieve what they want in love, sex and life.

This group is for men who have read the book and identify with the "Nice Guy Syndrome". It's a positive forum for motivated men to work through the book's breaking free activities, discuss your experiences and gain feedback. We organize monthly participant-run workshops for members, as well as social activities for networking and fun.

Important: This group is for men who are on the path of self-improvement. For this reason, it's a condition of attending our events that each participant has read the book. If you have not read the book, No More Mr Nice Guy by Dr. Robert Glover is available from major booksellers and online.
results.name: No More Mr Nice Guy - Boston (South Shore)

results.description:
Morning Star Sangha is a Boundless Way Zen practice group. We are a meditation group primarily for people new to Zen meditation and young adults, but we heartily welcome all practitioners. We meet Wednesday evenings from 7:00-8:30 PM at St. John's Episcopal Church, 297 Lowell Avenue, Newton, MA. Plenty of street parking is available. We enter the church through the red doors along Otis Street.  You are welcome to join us on any Wednesday evening, as your schedule allows. 

Our practice includes a liturgy service, 25 minute sitting periods, walking meditation, dharma talks, discussions, and personal meditation instruction in private interviews with a teacher. Talks and interviews will be offered by our practice leader, Boundless Way Zen Priest and Senior Dharma Teacher Michael Fieleke, and by visiting Boundless Way Zen teachers.

Morning Star Sangha is a community of Zen practitioners in the lineage of Boundless Way Zen, a school which combines Japanese Soto and Korean Rinzai traditions in innovative ways that include basic meditation practices such as breath awareness, mindfulness practices, inquiry into the moment, shikantaza (just sitting), and koan practice in the Harada-Yasutani tradition. 

If it is your first time sitting with a Boundless Way Zen group, please arrive 15 minutes early for an orientation. If you would like to ask questions or be added to our email list, please email mikefieleke@gmail.com. 

Check out our website at https://morningstarsangha.wordpress.com.
results.name: Morning Star Sangha

results.description:
This is a great opportunity to network with people in the community, have fun and keep your money in your pocket.

Free events, open to everyone, most of which take place in the Roxbury, Mattapan and Dorchester communities. We welcome everyone whether or not you live or work here in the neighborhood. We welcome everyone including members of the Lesbian, Gay, Bi-sexual and Transgender community. We welcome people of all ages, ethnicities and backgrounds.

If you live in the community and have an interest in taking a leadership role by organizing free events. Please message me. I would love to hear from you. "You don't need to be an expert to organize an awesome Meetup. You just need something you care about and a desire to bring people together."

Include your name, phone number, general availability and any questions you may have. I will plan on scheduling a meeting with you or talking with you at one of the upcoming events.

Why are there no events hosted in my section of the neighborhood?  If there are no events in your section of the neighborhood, it because I sincerely need your help.  This group is not just for one section of the community.  Please suggest location around where you live.  If you, yourself can't think of any good locations, please contact me anyway.  Maybe you can tell me a little about your neighborhood and I can find a solution.   Maybe I can show you what to look for.  I am trying to service the entire community - not just a portion. 617-818-0403

Boston Free Events - Hosted on facebook.com and not exclusive to the Dorchester, Mattapan and Roxbury Community www.BostonFreeEvents.com

Looking for early birds to walk together around beautiful Lowell. Weekdays 630am to 730am-ish . Meet at the park next to the parking garage on Market Street. Sometimes finish the walk at either the Club or the Owl diner.

results.description: Are you a private pilot (or aspiring pilot) for whom a weekend VFR forecast- or at least a forecast above minimums- compels you to ponder possible destinations? Do you look skyward at the sound of a piston single? If so, then join our Meetup to connect with others who share your interest in general aviation. We are for pilots of all experience levels, student, high time, low time, VFR, IFR, who live in metro Boston and want to meet other pilots to discuss and continue to learn about this demanding endeavor.

EmpowHer You Meditation/Reiki meets every Saturday in the Back Bay at Karma Yoga Studio. Each Empowher You class consists of 45 minutes of Max Meditation followed by 30 minutes of Ensofic Ray (Complete System of Reiki) in a group setting. No meditation experience or religious affiliation required. Everyone is welcome!

results.description:
Charles River Wheelmen (CRW) is a group of recreational cyclists who get together for weekly bicycle rides and frequent social events in the Boston area.

We provide a high quality year round recreational ride program with a friendly social atmosphere.  Our rides are open to the general public. If you like our rides and continue to ride with us, we ask you to please become a member. Membership dues help support the CRW Ride Program.  As a member you will receive discounts at participating bike shops, which can more than pay for your membership.  You can also participate in our events open only to members or other events at a reduced rate.

To join the club, click on this link:  

http://crw.org/MembershipApplication.php?join&src=m
results.name: Charles River Wheelmen Bicycle Club

results.description:
This group is for all women to gather, support each other, discuss our goals and believe, commit, and crush our goals in 2015. Whether you are new to running, have been running for years, or you haven't so much as taken your first steps yet, come gather with us in Boston for a great afternoon of fun and inspiration! (Yes, this means YOU! If you are the woman who is reading this, but isn't sure she can really call herself a runner, or the one who walks instead of runs-- you are welcome, or the one who doesn't know the first thing about running or walking but knows she has a dream and a goal for this year... please join us, we would love to connect with you. We would even welcome any fellas that would like to join in!). We kicked off this meetup with a fantastic event in February that coincided with Fellow Flowers National Declare it Day (#Declareitday is a national movement by Fellow Flowers encouraging and inspiring women to put words and dreams into action and declare a goal they are committed to working toward and achieving. For more information, visit http://fellowflowers.com/declareitday/)

If you weren't able to join us that day, don't worry-- we  will have several other meetups throughout the year to have the chance to connect with each other and find fresh motivation and accountability for your goals, as well as a whole lot of love and support to help get you through the challenges.
results.name: Boston Area #DeclareitDay Fitness Goal Crushers

results.description:
This meet up is for skiers and Riders In the Blackstone Valley area. WE can put a group together and travel together. Weather its a day trip, weekend trip of even a week trip out west. We can put our own trips together or utilize other clubs ( CMSG / AMC ) trips and discount lift tickets. This is open to skiers of all abilities. 

Also, let's not forget about the après ski. WO-ho!
results.name: Blackstone Valley Downhill Ski & Board Meetup

results.description: Hello fabulous ladies of Boston, welcome to the Splendid Living Society! The Ladies of Boston Splendid Living Society is dedicated to helping women live a life they are proud and passionate about. We offer exclusive content and workshops to our members in the realms of health, wellness, finance, careers, and relationships…and best of all, it’s free! We believe that every single one of you should be able to surround yourselves with a supportive and intimate community where you can connect with like-minded women, as well as have access to invaluable information to help you up-level your life in every way possible. We would be honored to welcome you into our fabulous and growing community. Join here: http://bit.ly/bostonSLS and an email with more info will be on its way!
results.name: The Ladies of Boston Splendid Living Society

results.description: Do you strive to be active and healthy and want to hang out with others who feel the same?? If you do, then this is a perfect group for you!  Our calendar includes:  fitness activities (walks, 5ks, dancing, hiking, biking, kayaking, etc..), sporting events, health and nutrition classes/festivals, exploring Boston, stress relief methods, volunteering, healthy dinners, coffee socials, wine tastings, happy hours, and more...Basically anything that gets you off the couch and moving!  If you share any of these interests and want to hang out with a group, please join and RSVP to meet up and have FUN!
results.name: Active, Healthy, and Social in Eastern Mass

results.description: Boston SPIN (Software Process Improvement Network) is a forum for free and open exchange of software process improvement experiences and ideas. The organization serves as a source of educational and scientific information for its members, other SPIN organizations, and the general software community. Members of Boston SPIN come from academic, government, and industry backgrounds. We are an independent, non-profit organization, and our membership is open to everyone. Boston SPIN meetings are free. No RSVP is necessary.

results.description: Danger!awesome is a laser cutting, etching, engraving, and 3D printing workshop in Central Square. We can work with a wide variety of materials including wood, plastic, fabric, leather, glass, stone, and metal. We work on custom projects ranging from architectural models to personalizing electronic devices. We also sell products developed in-house, and offer classes, workshops, events, and one-on-one laser training sessions. danger!awesome recently opened a second location on Massachusetts Avenue, making it possible for us to expand our retail, classes, and community events.
results.name: Cambridge Makers Meetup at danger!awesome

results.description:
Become the Perfect Partner While Meeting Potential Partners!

What if you could find the perfect partner today?  What would you say to them?  What would they look like?  How would they look at you?  How would being with them make you feel?  Imagine being with that perfect person right now.  

It's a great exercise to visualize your perfect partner, but while most people have a clear idea of who their perfect partner is, few stop to ask if THEY are the person that perfect partner would want to date. The fact is that creating a great relationship takes a lot of work. It requires skills. And those are things that we don't get taught in school.

We want you to be ready to step into that ultimate relationship with that perfect partner.  

So rather than going out on another random singles dating event, cruising OKCupid even one more time, or trolling the next bar, why not come out to an event where you know that the people attending aren't just looking for their next date, they're looking for "THE ONE" AND they're doing the work required to be "THE ONE" in return.

Each session will be a combination of skill building and getting a chance to meet other like-minded singles. It will give you the opportunity to learn about the other participants in a facilitated, non-awkward, low-commitment setting so that you have a chance to know people before you commit to a date. Andeven if your "one" isn't there this time, you've done something productive to be ready when they show up!

Some Topics We'll Cover:

Great Communication
Communication is the foundation of any great relationship. In these programs, you'll learn how to get deeper into connection with your partner. Learn the tricks to improving intimacy and learn the traps that can drag your relationship down.

Sacred Union - How to Have a Conscious Relationship
When you come together spiritually and sexually at the same time, you put yourself in a position to find that sacred union that can exist between two people. In these classes, you'll find out how to create better relationships, better connection, and a higher level of intimacy. 

Spiritual Growth
One of the things that takes us out of relationship quickly is fears, doubts, and insecurities. They are the biggest threat to us getting and keeping love in our lives. In these classes, we'll explore what it takes to really be comfortable in your own skin and how to let go of the fears and neediness that threaten your ability to have healthy relationships. 

Personal Power
In these classes, we'll be discussing how to claim and maintain your personal power. Personal power allows you to speak your truth, set and hold your boundaries, and face and overcome your fears. It's the foundation of any healthy relationship.

Energy Games
If you hope to create union with your partner, you'll need to learn how to move your energy and read your partner's energy. In these classes, you'll learn how to work with energy in a fun, hands-on environment. 

And More...
We will be offering a wide variety of classes to serve the needs of those seeking an intimate connection with their partner. All genders/orientations welcome.
results.name: Meet and Grow - Dating and Personal Growth Meetup

results.description:
MEETUP CREATED - Jan 28, 2015

JOIN THE GROUP AS WE BUILD OUR MEMBERSHIP BETWEEN NOW AND MAY 4TH, 2015

Boston Marketing Meetup is a Monthly get-together for anyone involved or interested in increasing their skillset in all aspects of Marketing, with primary emphasis on Digital! results.description:
Are you a gay man and living on or near Cape Ann? If so, then come out and join your neighbors for a little socializing! This group is open to all gay men, whether you're single, married, partnered, "it's complicated", etc. We're open to well-planned as well as flash (short noticed) events - so if you're going out to do something, throw it out there. In other words, members are encouraged to throw an idea out on the discussion board ala "I'm taking the dog to Good Harbor Thursday at 2:00, if you want to join me..." or "I'm seeing _____ on Sunday the 25th at 3:00 at _____, reply if you'd like to join me." FOR ALL THE DETAILS on posting an event, please see the post "POSTING AN EVENT" in the discussion forum. (You can find the the forum by looking at the top of the page - look under the words "Area Gay" in the title at the very top of this page.)

Please Note: We're unrelated to CAMEN (Cape Ann Men) or North Shore Men, which are also gay men's organizations in the area. (North Shore Men can be found at www.northshoremen.org. For info on CAMEN, please ask the group owner Chris.)

I'll also be looking for additional moderators to help approve events - if you're interested, please message me!

-Chris
results.name: Cape Ann Area Gay Men's Meetup

results.description:
Our mission is to enrich the lives of all citizens through diverse and innovative recreational programs and services. With a focus on the arts, sports and games, the outdoors, education, and celebrations, we provide both active and passive social opportunities that build community and inspire personal growth. Our parks provide support for active and passive recreation that contributes to enhancing the quality of life. The department encourages citizens to become active, responsible, and engaged members of the community.

Our vision is to be recognized leaders in municipal recreation in direct alignment with the three pillars of the National Recreation and Park Association (NRPA): Conservation, Health and Wellness, and Social Equity.
results.name: Canton Parks and Recreation

results.description: Race is a hard thing to write about, but bringing it into our fictional universes can enrich and expand them. The purpose of this group is to equip ourselves to write fiction about race in the most powerful and effective way. We do that by raising each other’s consciousness about race, racism and representation; by examining the way race plays out in our work and other people’s; and, of course, by drinking coffee and eating cookies. Every month we meet to workshop a story, paying close attention to issues of both craft and race. This group is for any fiction writer who writes about race or wants to start.
results.name: Race & Fiction Writing (Boston)

results.description:
Welcome OCEAN aficionados of the North East 

The mantra: Go to the Edge whenever possible 

The edge of the continent that is. 

Do you seek the rhythm of the ocean waves, the scent of salt water, the feel of sand, the sound of seabirds and crashing surf, the serenity, energy and peace you find at the beach? Appreciate the beauty of the vast marine life varieties? 

In your free time do you prefer 

O utdoors as much as indoors, like to 

C reate with nature, wish to have

E nvironmental awareness without guilt, seek 

A dventures in discovering what speaks to you and hope to add 

N ew friends into your life? 


• Low key meetup events focused on the ocean, marine life and the beaches of New England. 

• Held weekends over the next 9 months with the potential for more when opportunity and/or higher-volume group attendance indicate they would be welcomed. 

• Activities will be focused on visiting local destinations as well as those accessible within 3 hours of travel or less. The agendas will be varied - from simple beach combing to a weekend on Block Island and everything in between. Marine focused institutions will also find a place in our calendar. 

• Friendship, fresh air and refreshment will be encouraged for each event. 

• Carpool and use of public transport smiled upon
results.name: OCEAN aficionados of the North East

results.description:
So let me start by saying it isn't easy to find like minded friends amongst the hippie-yogi-meditator types in the young generations in Boston! Maybe you're in your twenties or thirties and you find yourself becoming increasingly more spiritually expansive with time, but yet simultaneously feel less and less completely able  "fit in" with the masses of mainstream thinking. Maybe you feel like you need a "tribe".  My hope is that this group will create a space where the younger generation of spiritual, open-hearted, open-minded, like-minded free-spirits can come together to connect with each other, share ideas, merge the philosophies of East & West, and grow. Let's start first by finding each other. Are you a lover of yoga, meditation, philosophy, zen, buddhism, hinduism, spirituality, hippies, free-spirits, crystals or transformational festivals? This may be a great place to make some new friends and have some fun!

My personal background is I was born to a couple teenage hippies and grew up in a Hindu based cult in Montana. I've been exposed to the ideas of the east, meditation, yoga and philosophy starting at a very young age. I've experienced traditional "success" in the business world but find more soul connection as a yoga & meditation instructor and my studies and travels at various ashrams around the world, especially in India. I've had a variety of spiritual experiences and have a thirst for learning from new teachers, philosophies and spiritual walks of life of every variety. I'm as open-minded as they come :) Look forward to hearing your story too!
results.name: Young Free spirited-Conscious-Hippie-Yogis

Learn to do Emotional Freedom Technique: EFT

results.description: This group is for anyone who is looking to transform their lives. Learn powerful tools and strategies that will make you more effective and produce the results you desire. Do you feel that negative emotions, beliefs, stuck patterns of behavior or inner blocks are preventing you from living life on your terms? Do you feel you are capable of so much more but unsure of how to get there? We will be exploring such tools as the Law of Attraction, Meditation, Guided Imagery, Hypnosis, NLP, EFT, Energy Work and more. Together we will co-create a safe sanctuary that will focus on your inner journey and will help you fast-track your sense of self empowerment, your goals and life purpose. We will break thru the hidden barriers that keep you from achieving the life you deserve now. You can experience greater harmony and balance, a feeling that new doors of opportunity are available, and things that seemed out of reach are now your reality. Develop renewed energy, vitality and enthusiasm as we learn how to empower, magnetize and create the changes that were once elusive. Anyone can change if your committed to making changes I invite you to join our group. All levels are welcome from beginner to expert. . I will help step you though your process and guide you to the results you wish to manifest now. Please visit my linked in profile to gain more insight into my background and techniques: http://www.linkedin.com/in/energy2heal I look forward to our journey together! Geoffrey Abeles

results.description: We’re an inclusive community of professional women, 50 and forward, whose changing life situations lead us to seek new connections and opportunities. We’re women who are continuing to learn and discover for personal and professional growth. And, we’re women who believe in challenging the conventional thinking about aging. We offer programs and events highlighting connections, information and inspiration. Our Peer Groups provide support and help in navigating life’s many transitions. Our Special Interest Groups connect women around common interests such as cultural activities, book clubs, restaurant exploration and travel.

results.description:
Are you a burnt out stay at home mom or full time working mom who has dreamt of a lifestyle that allows you to put your children, passions, talent, heart, soul, and love at the center of your life? Have you ever toyed with the idea of starting a side business that you could possibly grow into a full time career/life passion?

Consider this group your built in sisterhood community + playdate generator for your children + business strategy think tank! Mompreneurs are juggling a lot and the energy of mother entrepreneurs coming together with their children in a community of sisterhood support is a POWERFUL FORCE! Meetups can include brainstorming sessions, ideas for work life balance, creative time management strategies (especially managing our KIDS!), raising capital, marketing plans, etc. 

My name is Felicia, I am founder of the Mompreneur Soul and have built this FREE community to give Mompreneurs everywhere the space to bridge motherhood and entrepreneurship, a thing that is not easy to find! You can find out more about my business here at www.mompreneursoul.com. 


A Little About My Background

Over the course of my career I have noticed how most of my female peers, particularly mothers, were missing from top leadership positions across the corporate environment but were showing up in huge numbers as owners of small home based businesses. I began to question my own career and life decisions when I started a family and began to realize that there is far more to living a "successful" life than just earning a bigger salary and capturing a corner office, and that as a mother, that all came at a hefty price. In the midst of the American epidemic of career burnout, stress-related illnesses and erosion of family life, I started to question how mothers could be better supported in their struggle to allow both their business leadership and motherhood roles to coexist and simultaneously thrive. 

The result was years of doctoral research aimed at understanding the Mompreneur phenomenon, a recent societal trend where mothers are choosing to leave behind either a full time corporate career or a full time stay at home mom career for small business ownership. It became clear to me after years of interviews with mother-entrepreneurs across the country that these women were discovering a “loophole” to the mainstream career issues that plagued mothers for decades. Whether they had left behind a career as a corporate executive or they had been a stay at home mom for years and wanted to re-start a career, I noticed the common thread for these Mompreneur women was that they got what their soul was craving: the ability to simultaneously be a mom and have a career on their own terms, without sacrificing one for the other. These women confessed it wasn't an easy road to take, but at the end of the day they called the shots, they had more freedom to decide when they worked on the business or spending time with their children and they chose businesses that put their life passion and purpose at the center. 

 My question then was how could I help power moms everywhere stuck in the fear and dysfunction of the mainstream career matrix successfully transition into entrepreneurship, and how could I help corporations who were losing these valuable savvy women leaders foster a healthier culture and environment to better retain and empower them. The answer to this question was the birth of Mompreneur Soul, a consulting firm aimed at nurturing a women’s journey through motherhood and business leadership and entrepreneurship. My background includes being a mother, corporate executive, entrepreneur, business professor, certified career coach, and Kundalini yoga and meditation teacher, and my life work and passion is to revolutionize how our culture, our workplace and business leaders everywhere re-think motherhood and leadership, and how mothers can infuse soul into their families, careers and businesses.
results.name: Mompreneur Soul Productive Playdates

results.description: Looking for some fun and healthy sober activities in Boston that also help you along in recovery? Well look no further! Come to Soba Yoga; Yoga for Recovery. Vinyasa yoga classes geared to create a healing community for anyone who is in the healing process from substance abuse or related addictive behaviors. Classes are All Levels, therefore beginners are definitely welcome. Soba Yoga classes are taught by Stephanie Troy, LICSW, RYT who is a social worker, nutrition coach, yoga teacher and Reiki II practitioner who has worked in the field of addiction for over 15 years. Whether you associate with having an addiction or not, Soba Yoga can help you move through old baggage and release what you no longer need. At the heart, Soba Yoga believes that transformation, happiness and healing are possible for all.
results.name: Soba Yoga; Yoga For Recovery

topics.name: Singles, Friends, Social Network, Enjoying Life

results.description: This group is for fun, happy, women (40+) who would love to get out and expand their circle of friends. Most meet-ups will be in and around the North Shore area but we may venture out on occasion. Activities will include events like dining out, cocktails, crafts, museum visits, walks, local fairs or anything else that sounds like FUN. Ideas for events are welcome. Looking forward to meeting all you fun ladies for lots of laughs.  Please have a picture with a recognizable face shot when joining.
results.name: North Shore Fun & Friends for Women (40+)

results.description: Calling South Shore gay men and friends. Lets get together for a friendly Pot Luck Dinner gathering at my place in North Randolph. Singles, couples everyone is welcome. I'm starting this group to connect with good people in fairly close proximity embracing good, friends, food, and conversation. Asking everyone please bring one dish and specify in advance to avoid repeats. Limit is about 20 people for now but may expand in warmer season with my deck space. Don't be shy and join us for a good time!
results.name: Gay Mens South Shore Pot Luck Meetup

topics.name: Retirement: A Time for Life Expansion & Creativity

results.description: Navigating or nearing retirement without a partner? Let's create a fulfilling new life stage & community--plus enjoy fun social events (rewiring rather than retiring). Nearly all meetings will take place in T accessible locations in Boston, Cambridge, and Somerville.
results.name: Friendship, fun & growth for boomers+ facing retirement solo

results.description: Each month we will announce a theme from which members can jump start their creativity. Near the end of the month, we will find a place to meet up for a critique. This is open to all mediums and levels. We want to encourage a multidisciplinary group that can provide diverse feedback, as well as giving individuals a jump start to break through creative blocks. We plan to add photos to a facebook page for ongoing critiques and for members that aren’t able to come to every meeting. Rules: Any medium as long as it relates to the theme for the month or the previous month. You do not need to bring a final piece, working drafts are fine. If the theme was “Red,” you could bring a painting, sculpture, knit item (or photograph of one of these), play a video, song, food, etc. that relates to the theme. i.e.: a mostly red painting, a photograph of a sculpture made of redwood, a red scarf, a video of a red balloon, a song about a red-haired lover or red velvet cupcakes to share. You do not need to bring work to attend or attend every month. However, when joining in the critiques we ask that comments are thoughtful, relevant and respectful. This group is about getting unstuck and seeing where working in this spontaneous way takes us!
results.name: Boston area Jump stART

results.description:
Boston is home to some of the worlds most innovative companies. Since we love the startup community,  we want to celebrate them! 


Like anything in life, what you put into a networking group is what you get out of it. The Tech Playground is designed for entrepreneurs and professionals alike, who are serious about building their business, investing in relationships, and helping each other to succeed. 1) Regular attendance 2) Dedication to coming prepared to contribute value to the community with expertise, experience, and networks. 3) Create a fun and supportive environment! Price: FREE Remember to bring plenty of business cards !

results.description:
Get together with other Digital Analytics professionals in the area for networking and to discuss industry trends, tips, and practices you're using to find success. 

I also encourage you to participate in Discussions here on the group's message board and provide any recommendations or ideas that you have for future events.


What is Digital Analytics?  Wondering if this group is for you?

“Digital analytics is the analysis of qualitative and quantitative data from your business and the competition to drive a continual improvement of the online experience that your customers and potential customers have which translates to your desired outcomes (both online and offline)

With the right skills, processes and technologies, you can uncover the vital information about how you engage with your customers, effectiveness of your engagements and give you the data on which to take action to improve the outcome – business results”. - Avinash Kaushik

results.description: Welcome to the Intel® Hack & Tell Boston group! This meet-up series invites you - the developer - to demo your projects and interact with an audience of like-minded folks. Anyone is welcome to present at the next event, keeping it within 15 minutes and avoiding slide-ware. We will be covering the Android platform, HTML5 tools and frameworks, IoT and other platforms to make these meetups interesting for a diverse audience. The presentations will be developer-driven, with a sprinkling of industry professionals and influencers invited to demo side by side with meet up attendees. This group is sponsored by Intel and their developer team will be joining us to showcase code samples and some of their latest demos. Bring your hacks, and your friends, and join us for a night of geekiness powered by pizza and beer! Email ricardo@bemyapp.com if you are interested in giving a demo of your Android project or app!

results.description: We are a sister group of the Diabetes Pedal Pushers in Nebraska (started in 2014). We are a group of people who are adults with Type 1 Diabetes and looking for an active and social outlet for adults 18 and over as well as their family and friends who want to participate! We have educational and social gatherings, and as the name implies...we like to ride our bikes (once the weather gets warmer). We are a group that will meet in the Milford/Hopkinton area, but will expand as the weather gets nicer (to do group bike rides)...Hope you are ready to get moving!
results.name: Diabetes Pedal Pushers MA
